sourceString: Constructed in 14 days, the lab is capable of conducting tens of thousands RT-PCR tests per day and is the first in the world of this scale to be operational outside of China.
targetString: Yakhiwe ezinsukwini ezingu-14, ilebhu ikwazi ukuqondisa amashumi ezinkulungwane zokuhlola nge-RT-PCR ngosuku futhi eyokuqala emhlabeni yalelizinga esebenzayo ngaphandle kwase-China.

sourceString: Different testing recipes targeting different parts of the coronavirus genetic profile were developed in China, France, Germany, Hong Kong, Japan, and the United States.
targetString: Izinqubo ezingafani zokuhlola okuqonda kumalungu angafani ezakhi ze-coronavirus zakhiwa e-China, e-France, e-Germany, e-Hong Kong, e-Japan, nase-United States.

sourceString: The World Health Organization adopted the German recipe for manufacturing kits sent to low-income countries without the resources to develop their own.
targetString: I-World Health Organization yakhetha inqubo yase-German yokwakhiwa kwamakhithi athunyelwa emazweni antulayo kwezemali angenazo izinsiza zokuzakhela awazo.

sourceString: The German recipe was published on 17 January 2020; the protocol developed by the United States Centers for Disease Control was not available until 28 January, delaying available tests in the U.S.China and the United States had problems with the reliability of test kits early in the outbreak, and these countries and Australia were unable to supply enough kits to satisfy demand and recommendations for testing by health experts.
targetString: Inqubo yase-German yanyatheliswa ngo-17 January 2020; inqubomthetho eyasungulwa yi-United States Centers for Disease Control ayizange itholakale kwaze kwaba ngu-28 January, kwalibazisa ukuhlola okutholakalayu e-U.S. I-China ne-United States babhekana nezinkinga zokuthembakala kwamakhithi okuhlola ekuqaleni kokuqubuka, futhi lamazwe ne-Australia awakwazanga ukwakha nokukhipha amakhithi anele ukwanelisa isidingo nokukhuthaza kpchwepheshe bezezempilo.

sourceString: In contrast, experts say South Korea's broad availability of testing helped reduce the spread of the novel coronavirus.
targetString: Ngokungafani, ochwepheshe bathi ukutholakala okubanzi kokuhlola e-South Korea kusizile kwanciphisa ukusabalala kwe-coronavirus entsha.

sourceString: Testing capacity, largely in private sector labs, was built up over several years by the South Korean government.
targetString: Amandla okuqukatha ukuhlola, ikakhulukazi kumalebhu azimele, akhiwa esikhathini seminyaka eminingi nguhulumeni wase-South Korean.

sourceString: On 16 March, the World Health Organization called for ramping up the testing programmes as the best way to slow the advance of COVID-19 pandemic.High demand for testing due to wide spread of the virus caused backlogs of hundreds of thousands of tests at private U.S. labs, and supplies of swabs and chemical reagents became strained.
targetString: Ngo 16 March, i-World Health Organization yabizela ukunikwa amandla kwezinqubo zokuhlola njengendlela engcono kakhulu yokunensisa ukungenisa kobhubhane i-COVID-19. Isidingo esiphakeme sokuhlola ngenxa yobubanzi bokusabalala kwegciwane kwabangela ukunqwabelana komsebebenzi wamakhulu ezinkulungwane kumalebhu ase-U.S. azimele, futhi ukukhishwa kwama-swabs nama-chemical reagents kwacindezela.

sourceString: In March 2020 China reported problems with accuracy in their test kits.
targetString: Ngo March 2020 i-China yabika izinkinga ngokunemba kwamakhithi okuhlola ayo.

sourceString: In the United States, the test kits developed by the CDC had "flaws;" the government then removed the bureaucratic barriers that had prevented private testing.Spain purchased test kits from Chinese firm  Shenzhen Bioeasy Biotechnology Co Ltd, but found that results were inaccurate.
targetString: E-United States, amakhithi okuhlola ayakhiwe i-CDC atholakala "enamaphutha;" uhulumeni wasusa izindonga zomthetho ebezivimbela ukuhlola ngasese. I-Spain yathenga amakhithi enkampanini yase-China i-Shenzhen Bioeasy Biotechnology Co Ltd, kodwa yathola ukuthi imiphumela yayinganembile.

sourceString: The firm explained that the incorrect results may be a result of a failure to collect samples or use the kits correctly.
targetString: Inkampani yachaza ukuthi imiphumela eyiphutha kungenzeka ibangelwa ukwehlulela ukuqoqa amasampula noma ukusebenzisa amakhithi ngendlela efanele.

sourceString: The Spanish ministry said it will withdraw the kits that returned incorrect results, and would replace them with a different testing kit provided by Shenzhen Bioeasy.80% of test kits the Czech Republic purchased from China gave wrong results.Slovakia purchased 1.2 million test kits from China which were found to be inaccurate.
targetString: I-Spanish ministry yathi izowakhipha amakhithi aveze imiphumela eyiphutha, futhi izofaka esikhaleni sawo amakhithi ahlukile ahlinzekelwe i-Shenzhen Bioeasy. U-80% owamakhithi okuhlola i-Czech Republic ewathenge e-China akhipha imiphumela eyiphutha. I-Slovakia yathenga amakhithi okuhlola ayizigidi ezingu-1.2 e-China atholakala ukuthi awanembile.

sourceString: Prime Minister Matovič suggested these be dumped into the Danube.Ateş Kara of the Turkish Health Ministry said the test kits Turkey purchased from China had a "high error rate" and did not "put them into use."The UK purchased 3.5 million test kits from China but in early April 2020 announced these were not usable.
targetString: I-Prime Minister u-Matovič waphakamisa ukuthi mawalahlwe ngokufakwa e-Danube. U-Ateş Kara we-Turkish Health Ministry uthe amakhithi okuhlola i-Turkeyewathenge e-China atholakala ene- "zinga eliphakeme lamaphutha" futhi awazange a-"asetshenziswe." I-UK yathenga amakhithi okuhlola eyizigidi ezingu-3.5 e-China kodwa ekuqaleni kuka-April 2020 yamemezela ukuthi awasebenziseki.

sourceString: Testing, followed with quarantine of those who tested positive and tracing of those with whom the SARS-CoV-2 positive people had had contact, resulted in positive outcomes.
targetString: Ukuhlola, kulandelwe ukuvalelwa kwalabo abatholakala beqinisekisa lapho behlolwa futhi kwalandelelwa labo bantu ababe nokuthintana nabantu ababonise ukuqinisekisa uma kuhlolelwa i-SARS-CoV-2, imiphumela ibe ukuqinisekisa nakhona.

sourceString: Researchers working in the Italian town of Vò, the site of the first COVID-19 death in Italy, conducted two rounds of testing on the entire population of about 3,400 people, about ten days apart.
targetString: Abacwaningi abasebenza edolobheni lase-Italy i-Vò, indawo yokufa kokuqala kwe-COVID-19 e-Italy, baqondisa ukujikeleza okubili kokuhlola wlonke inani labantu abangu-3,400, okungenani izinsuku eziyishumi ngokuqhela.

sourceString: About half the people testing positive had no symptoms, and all discovered cases were quarantined.
targetString: Okungenani ingxenye yabantu abaqisekisa lapho behlolwa babenganazo izimpawu, futhi zonke izibonelo ezatholakala zavalelwa.

sourceString: With travel to the commune restricted, this eliminated new infections completely.
targetString: Njengoba ukuvakashelana kukhawuliwe, lokhu kususa ukuthelelana okusha ngokuphelele.

sourceString: With aggressive contact tracing, inbound travel restrictions, testing, and quarantining, the 2020 coronavirus pandemic in Singapore has proceeded much more slowly than in other developed countries, but without extreme restrictions like forced closure of restaurants and retail establishments.
targetString: Ngokulandelela abathintiwe ngomdlandla, ukuvakasha okungenayo kukhawuliwe, ukuhlola, nokuvalela, ubhubhane luka-2020 lwe-coronavirus e-Singapore luqhubeke ngokunensa kakhulu kunamanye amazwe athuthukile, kodwa ngaphandle kwemingcele enzima njengokuphoqa ukuvalwa kwezitolo zokudla nezinye zokudayisa.

sourceString: Many events have been cancelled, and Singapore did start advising residents to stay at home on 28 March, but schools reopened on time after holiday break on 23 March.
targetString: Izenzkalo eziningi zikhanseliwe, futhi i-Singapore yaqala ukweluleka izakhamuzi ukuthi zihlale emakhaya ngo-28 March, kodwa izikole zavula ngesikhathi ngemuva kwekhefu lamaholidi ngo-23 March.

sourceString: Several other countries have also managed the pandemic with aggressive contact tracing, inbound travel restrictions, testing, and quarantining, but with less aggressive lock-downs, such as Iceland and South Korea.
targetString: Amazwe amaningana nawo akwazile ukunakekela ubhubhane ngomdlandla wokulandelela abathintanile, ukukhawula uhambo lwangaphakathi, ukuhlola, nokuvalelwa, kodwa ngezinga elincane ekuvaleni-phansi, njenge-Iceland ne-South Korea.

sourceString: A statistical study has found that countries that have tested more, relative to the number of deaths, have much lower case fatality rates, probably because these countries are better able to detect those with only mild or no symptoms.
targetString: Ucwaningo lwezibalo luthole ukuthi amazwe ahlole ngokwengeziwe, uma kuqhathaniswa nesibalo sabafile, anezibonelo eziphansi zamazinga okufa, okungabangelwa isizathu sokuthi asesimweni esingcono sokuphenya labo abanezimpawu ezintukuntuku noma abangenazo nhlobo.

sourceString: WHO recommends that countries that do not have testing capacity and national laboratories with limited experience on COVID-19 send their first five positives and the first ten negative COVID-19 samples to one of the 16 WHO reference laboratories for confirmatory testing.
targetString: I-WHO ikhuthaza ukuthi amazwe angenawo amandla okuqukatha ukuhlola futhi anamalebhu esizwe anokuhlangenwe nakho okulinganiselwe nge-COVID-19 athumele amasampula aqinisekayo amahlanu okuqala nayishumi andulayo e-COVID-19 kweyodwa yamalebhu okuthenjwa angu-16 e-WHO azoqinisekisa ukuhlola.

sourceString: Out of the 16 reference laboratories, 7 are in Asia, 5 in Europe, 2 in Africa, 1 in North America and 1 in Australia.
targetString: Phakathi kwamalebhu okuthenjwa angu-16, angu-7 ase-Asia, angu-5 ase-Europe, angu-2 ase-Africa, engu-1 ise-North America futhi engu-1 ise-Australia.

sourceString: In the following chart, the column “Positive as % of tests” is influenced by the country's testing policy.
targetString: Eshadini elilandelayo, ikholamu “Okuqinisekisayo % kokuhlola” kuthonywa inqubomgomo yokuhlola kwezwe.

sourceString: A country that only tests people admitted to hospitals will have a higher positive as % of tests than a country that tests all citizens, whether or not they are showing symptoms, other things being equal.
targetString: Izwe elihlola kuphela abantu abamukelwe ezibhedlela lizoba nabaningi abaqinisekiswayo nge-% yokuhlola kunezwe elihlola zonke izakhamuzi zalo, kungakhathaliseki ukuthi babonisa izimpawu yini noma cha, ezinye izinto zilingane.

sourceString: Hand washing (or handwashing), also known as hand hygiene, is the act of cleaning one's hands for the purpose of removing soil, grease, microorganisms, or other unwanted substances.
targetString: Ukuhlanza izandla (noma ukuwash'izandla), okaziwa futhi ngokuthi inhlanzeko yezandla, isenzo sokuzicoca izandla ngenhloso yokususa inhlabathi, ugrisi, izinto ezincane, noma izitaputapu ezingafuneki.

sourceString: Hand washing with soap consistently at certain "critical moments" during the day prevents the spread of many diseases, for example diarrhoea and cholera, which are transmitted through fecal–oral route.
targetString: Ukuhlanza izandla ngensipho ngokungalibali kulezo "zikhathi ezibucayi" phakathi nosuku kuvikela ukusabalala kwezifo eziningi, ngokwesibonelo uhudo nekholera, okuthelelana ngenqubo ethi uthuvi–umlomo yokwenzeka.

sourceString: People can also become infected with respiratory diseases such as influenza or the common cold, for example, if they do not wash their hands before touching their eyes, nose, or mouth (i.e., mucous membranes).
targetString: Abantu bangaphinde batheleleke ngezifo zokuphefumula njengomkhuhlane noma amakhaza avamile, ngokwesibonelo, uma bengazihlanzi izandla zabo ngaphambi kokuzithinta amehlo, ikhala, noma umlomo (i.e., izici ezisamafinyila).

sourceString: The five critical moments during the day where washing hands with soap is important include: before and after defecation, after cleaning a child's bottom or changing nappies, before feeding a child, before eating and before and after preparing food or handling raw meat, fish, or poultry.
targetString: Izinkathi ezibucayi ezinhlanu phakathi nosuku lapho ukuhlanza izandla ngensipho kubalulekile kuhlanganisa: ngaphambili nangemuva kokuzikhulula, ngemuva kokuhlanza izinqa zosana noma ukushintsha amanephi, ngaphambi kokufunza usana, ngaphambi kokudla nangaphambi nangemuva kokulungisa ukudla noma ukuphatha inyama engaphekiwe, inhlanzi, noma izinyoni ezifuywayo.

sourceString: If water and soap are not available, hands can be cleaned with ash.The World Health Organization recommends washing hands:
targetString: Uma amanzi nensipho kungatholakali, izandla zingahlanzwa ngomlotha. I-World Health Organization ikhuthaza ukuhlanzwa kwezandla:

sourceString: Before, during, and after preparing food.
targetString: Ngaphambi, phakathi, nangemuva kokulungisa ukudla.

sourceString: Before and after caring for a sick person.
targetString: Ngaphambi nangemuva kokunakekela umuntu ogulayo.

sourceString: After changing the diapers or cleaning up a child who has used the toilet.
targetString: Ngemuva kokushintsha amanephi noma kokuhlanza ingane ebisebenzisa indlu yangasese.

sourceString: After blowing your nose, coughing or sneezing.
targetString: Ngemuva kokufinya, ukukhwehlela noma ukuthimula.

sourceString: After touching animal, animal feed, or animal waste.
targetString: Ngemuva kokuthinta isilwane, ukudla kwesilwane, noma ukungcolisa kwesilwane.

sourceString: Medical hand hygiene refers to hygiene practices related to medical procedures.
targetString: Inhlanzeko yezandla yezokwelapha ibhekisela ezindleleni zenhlanzeko ezihlobene nenqubo yezokwelapha.

sourceString: Hand washing before administering medicine or medical care can prevent or minimize the spread of disease.
targetString: Ukuhlanza izandla ngaphambi kokunikeza umuthi noma usizo lokwelapha lungavikela noma lunciphise ukusabalala kwesifo.

sourceString: The main medical purpose of washing hands is to cleanse the hands of pathogens (bacteria, viruses, or other microorganisms that can cause disease) and chemicals which can cause harm or diseases.
targetString: Injongo eyinhloko yezokwelapha yokuhlanza izandla ukukhuculula ngokucoca izandla ama-pathogens (ama-bacteria, ama-viruses, noma amanye ama-microorganisms angabangela izifo) namakhemikhali angabangela ukulimala noma izifo.

sourceString: This is especially important for people who handle food or work in the medical field, but also an important practice for the general public.
targetString: Lokhu kubaluleke kakhulu kubantu abaphatha ukudla noma abasebenza kumkhakha wezokwelapha, kodwa kuyinqubo ebalulekile ngisho nakumphakathi ovamile.

sourceString: Hand washing has many health benefits, including minimizing the spread of influenza, coronavirus, and other infectious diseases; preventing infectious causes of diarrhea; decreasing respiratory infections;
targetString: Ukuhlanza izandla kunezinzuzo zempilo eziningi, kuhlanganisa ukunciphisa ukusabalala komkhuhlane, i-coronavirus, nezinye izifo ezithelelayo; ekuvikeleni izimbangela ezithelelanayo zohudo; ukunciphisa izifo zokuphefumula;

sourceString: and reducing infant mortality rate at home birth deliveries.
targetString: nokunciphisa izinga lokufa kwezinsana ekubeletheleni ekhaya.

sourceString: A 2013 study showed that improved hand washing practices may lead to small improvements in the length growth in children under five years of age.
targetString: Ucwaningo lango-2013 lwabonisa ukuthi inqubo yokuhlanza izandla ethuthukile ingase iholele ezingeni elincane lokuthuthuka ebudeni bokukhula kwezingane ezingaphansi kweminyaka eyisihlanu.

sourceString: In developing countries, childhood mortality rates related to respiratory and diarrheal diseases can be reduced by introducing simple behavioral changes, such as hand washing with soap.
targetString: Emazweni asathuthuka, izinga lokufa kwabasha oluhlobene nezifo zokuphefumula nohudo lingancishiswa ngokuqalisa ushintsho lokuziphatha olulula, njengokuhlanza izandla ngensipho.

sourceString: This simple action can reduce the rate of mortality from these diseases by almost 50%.
targetString: Isenzo esilula singanciphisa izinga lokufa ngalezizifo cishe ngo-50%.

sourceString: Interventions that promote hand washing can reduce diarrhoea episodes by about a third, and this is comparable to providing clean water in low income areas.
targetString: Izindlela zokungenela ezikhuthaza ukuhlanza izandla ngensipho zinganciphisa iziqephu zohudo ngezinxenye ezintathu, futhi lokhu kungaqhathaniswa nokuhlinzekela amanzi ahlanzekile ezindaweni ezintulayo ngokwezimali.

sourceString: 48% of reductions in diarrhoea episodes can be associated with hand washing with soap.Hand washing with soap is the single most effective and inexpensive way to prevent diarrhea and acute respiratory infections (ARI), as automatic behavior performed in homes, schools, and communities worldwide.
targetString: Ukuncipha kweziqephu zohudo ngo-48% kungahlobaniswa nokuhlanza izandla ngensipho. Ukuhlanza izandla ngensipho indlela eyodwa esebenza kahle futhi eyindleko encane ukuze kuvikelwe uhudo nama-acute respiratory infections (ARI), njengenqubo yokuziphatha ezenzekalelayo eyenzeka emakhaya, ezikoleni, nasemiphakathini emhlabeni wonke.

sourceString: Pneumonia, a major ARI, is the number one cause of mortality among children under five years old, taking the lives of an estimated 1.8 million children per year.
targetString: Inyumoniya, eyi-ARI enkulu, ihola yodwa njengembangela yokufa kwezinsana ezingaphansi kweminyaka eyisihlanu, ichitha izimpilo zezingane ezilinganiselwa ku-1.8 wezigidi ngonyaka.

sourceString: Diarrhea and pneumonia together account for almost 3.5 million child deaths annually.
targetString: Uhudo nenyumoniya kokubili kunesandla ekufeni kwezinsana eziyizigidi cishe ezingu-3.5 ngonyaka.

sourceString: According to UNICEF, turning hand washing with soap before eating and after using the toilet into an ingrained habit can save more lives than any single vaccine or medical intervention, cutting deaths from diarrhea by almost half and deaths from acute respiratory infections by one-quarter.
targetString: Ngokusho kwe-UNICEF, ukuguqula ukuhlamba izandla ngensipho ngaphi kokudla futhi nangemuva kokusebenzisa indlu yangasese ukuthi kube umkhuba ogxilile kungasindisa izimpilo ezengeziwe kunanoma iliphi ikhambi elilodwa noma ukungenela kwezokwelapha, kunquma ukufa ngenxa yesizathu sohudo cishe ngengxenye nokufa ngezifo zokuphefumula ngengxenye eyodwa.

sourceString: Hand washing is usually integrated together with other sanitation interventions as part of water, sanitation and hygiene (WASH) programmes.
targetString: Ukuhlanza izandla ngokuvamile kuhlanganiswe ndawonye nokunye ukungenela kokuthutha udoti njengenxenye yamanzi, izinhlelo zokuthutha udoti nenhlanzeko (i-WASH).

sourceString: Hand washing also protects against impetigo which is transmitted through direct physical contact.
targetString: Ukuhlanza izandla kuphinde kuvikele kusifo se-impetigo esidluliselana ngokuthintana okuqondile.

sourceString: A small detrimental effect of hand washing is that frequent hand washing can lead to skin damage due to drying of the skin.
targetString: Ingozi encane eba khona njengomphumela wokuhlanza izandla njalo ukulimala kwesikhumba okubangelwa ukoma kwesikhumba.

sourceString: A 2012 Danish study found that excessive hand washing can lead to an itchy, flaky skin condition known as hand eczema or hand dermatitis, which is especially common among health-care workers.
targetString: Ucwaningo lwama-Danish lango-2012 lathola ukuthi ukuhlanza izandla ngokweqile kungaba nomphumela wokuluma, nesimo sesikhumba esinoqweqwe esaziwa ngokuthi i-hand eczema noma i-hand dermatitis, okuyinto evame kakhulu kubantu abangabasebenzi bokunakekela impilo.

sourceString: Too frequent hand washing is also seen as one of the symptoms of obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD).
targetString: Ukuhlanza izandla kaningi kuphinde kubonakale njengenye yezimpawu ze-obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD).

sourceString: There are five critical times during the day where washing hands with soap is important to reduce fecal-oral transmission of disease: after using the bathroom (urination, defecation), after cleaning a child's bottom (changing nappies), before feeding a child, before eating and before/after preparing food or handling raw meat, fish, or poultry.
targetString: Kunezikhathi ezibucayi ezinhlanu phakathi nosuku lapho ukuhlanza izandla ngensipho kubaluleke khona ukunciphisa ukudlulisela isifo ngenqubo yendle-ngomlomo: ngemuva kokusebenzisa ildlu yangasese (ukuchama, ukuzikhulula), ngemuva kokuhlanza izinqa zosana (ukushintsha amanephi), ngamphambi kokufunza usana, ngaphambi kokudla noma ngaphambi/ngemuva kokulungisa ukudla noma kokuphatha inyama engaphekiwe, inhlanzi, noma izinyoni ezifuywayo.

sourceString: Other occasions when correct handwashing technique should be practiced in order to prevent the transmission of disease include before and after treating a cut or wound; after sneezing, coughing, or blowing your nose; after touching animal waste or handling animals; and after touching garbage.
targetString: Ezinye izikhathi lapho inqubo efanele yokuhlanza izandla kufanele ilandelwe ukuze kugwenywe ukudlulisela kwesifo kuhlanganisa ngaphambi nangemuva kokunakekela ukusikeka noma ukukulimala; ngemuva kokuthimula, ukukhwehlela, noma ukufinya; ngemuva kokuthinta udoti wesilwane noma ukuphatha izilwane; nangemuva kokuthinta udoti.

sourceString: In many countries, there is a low rate of hand washing with soap.
targetString: Emazweni amaningi, kunezinga eliphansi lokuhlanza izandla ngensipho.

sourceString: A study of hand washing in 54 countries in 2015 found that on average, 38.7% of households practiced hand washing with soap.A 2014 study showed that Saudi Arabia had the highest rate of 97 percent; the United States near the middle with 77 percent; and China with the lowest rate of 23 percent.Several behaviour change methodologies now exist to increase uptake of the behaviour of hand washing with soap at the critical times.Group hand washing for school children at set times of the day is one option in developing countries to engrain hand washing in children's behaviors.
targetString: Ucwaningo lokuhlanza izandla emazweni angu-54 ngo-2015 lathola ukuthi ngokwesilinganiso, u-38.7% wemikhaya ulandela inqubo yokuhlanza izandla ngensipho. Ucwaningo lango-2014 labonisa ukuthi i-Saudi Arabia yayinezinga eliphakeme kakhululu lamaphesenti angu-97; i-United States eduze naphakathi ngamaphesenti angu-77; ne-China nezinga eliphansi kakhulu lamaphesenti angu-23. Izinqubo ezimbalwa zemikhuba sezikhona manje ekukhuphuleni ukwamukela umkhuba wokuhlanza izandla ngensipho ngezikhathi ezibucayi. Ukuhlanza izandla njengeqembu kwezingane zesikole ngezikhathi ezimisiwe zosuku enye yazo emazweni asathuthuka ukuze kugxiliswe ukuhlanza izandla emikhubeni yezingane.

sourceString: The "Essential Health Care Program" implemented by the Department of Education in the Philippines is an example of at scale action to promote children's health and education.
targetString: I-"Essential Health Care Program" eyaqaliswa i-Department of Education e-Philippines iyisibonelo yesenzo sesibalo sokukhuthaza ezempilo zezingane nezemfundo.

sourceString: Deworming twice a year, supplemented with washing hands daily with soap, brushing teeth daily with fluoride, is at the core of this national program.
targetString: Ukukhipha izikelemu kabili ngonyaka, kuhambisane nokuhlanza izandla njalo ngensipho, ukuxubha nsukuzonke nge-fluoride, kuyinsika yohlelo lwezwe.

sourceString: It has also been successfully implemented in Indonesia.
targetString: Iqaliswe ngempumelelo futhi nase-Indonesia.

sourceString: Removal of microorganisms from skin is enhanced by the addition of soaps or detergents to water.
targetString: Ukususa ama-microorganisms esikhumbeni kuba nakangcono ngokufakwa kwensipho noma okokuhlanza emanzini.

sourceString: The main action of soaps and detergents is to reduce barriers to solution, and increase solubility.
targetString: Umsebenzi oyinhloko wensipho nokokuhlanza ukunciphisa izinto ezivimba isixazululo, futhi zikhuphule i-solubility.

sourceString: Water alone is an inefficient skin cleanser because fats and proteins, which are components of organic soil, are not readily dissolved in water.
targetString: Amanzi wodwa awanele ekuhlanzeni isikhumba ngoba amafutha namaphrotheyini, ayizakhiwo zenhlabathi, awancibiliki kalula emanzini.

sourceString: Cleansing is, however, aided by a reasonable flow of water..
targetString: Ukuhlanza, kodwa, kusizwa amanzi agelezayo ngokwezinga..

sourceString: Solid soap, because of its reusable nature, may hold bacteria acquired from previous uses.
targetString: ensipho eyiqhuzu, ngoba iyakwazi ukuphinde isebenze, ingase igcine igciwane elisale ekusebenzeni kwangaphambili.

sourceString: A small number of studies which have looked at the bacterial transfer from contaminated solid soap have concluded transfer is unlikely as the bacteria are rinsed off with the foam.
targetString: Isibalo esincane socwaningo olubheke ukudlulisela kwegciwane elisuka ensiphweni eyiqhuzu ethole ukungcola kuphethe ngokuthi akunakwenzeka njengoba amagciwane ehlambululeka kanye negwebu.

sourceString: The CDC still states "liquid soap with hands-free controls for dispensing is preferable".
targetString: I-CDC isaqhubeka ukuthi "insipho ewuketshezi nokulawula okukhipha ngaphandle kwezandla kungcono".

sourceString: Antibacterial soaps have been heavily promoted to a health-conscious public.
targetString: Izinsipho eziqeda amagciwane zikhangiswe kakhulu amalungu omphakathi okhathalela ezempilo.

sourceString: To date, there is no evidence that using recommended antiseptics or disinfectants selects for antibiotic-resistant organisms in nature.
targetString: Kuze kube namuhla, abukho ubufakazi bokuthi ukusebenzisa okuphakamiswayo kama-antiseptics noma ama-disinfectants ngenjongo yama-antibiotic-resistant organisms emvelo.

sourceString: However, antibacterial soaps contain common antibacterial agents such as triclosan, which has an extensive list of resistant strains of organisms.
targetString: Nokho, izinsipho ezi-antibacterial zinezimeleli ezivamile zama-antibacterial njenge-triclosan, enohlu elude lwama-resistant strains ama-organisms.

sourceString: So, even if antibiotic resistant strains aren't selected for by antibacterial soaps, they might not be as effective as they are marketed to be.
targetString: Ngakho, ngisho noma ama-antibiotic resistant strains engakhethiwe insipho e-antibacterial, kungenzeka ingakwazi ukusebenza kahle ngendlela edayiselwa yona.

sourceString: Besides the surfactant and skin-protecting agent, the sophisticated formulations may contain acids (acetic acid, ascorbic acid, lactic acid) as pH regulator, antimicrobially active benzoic acid and further skin conditioners (aloe vera, vitamins, menthol, plant extracts).A comprehensive analysis from the University of Oregon School of Public Health indicated that plain soaps are as effective as consumer-grade anti-bacterial soaps containing triclosan in preventing illness and removing bacteria from the hands.
targetString: Ngaphandle kwalokho i-surfactant nesimeleli esivikela isikhumba, izakhiwo eziyinkimbinkimbi zingase zibe nama-acids (i-acetic acid, i-ascorbic acid, i-lactic acid) njengesilawuli se-pH, i-antimicrobially active benzoic acid nezinye izinakekeli zesikhumba (i-aloe vera, ama-vitamins, i-menthol, ama-plant extracts). Ukuhlolisisa okubanzi okuvela e-University of Oregon School of Public Health keabomisa ukuthi izinsipho ezingenalutho zisebenza ngokuphumlela ngendlela efanayo nama-consumer-grade anti-bacterial soaps ane-triclosan ekuvikeleni ukugula nokususa amagciwane ezadleni.

sourceString: Hot water that is comfortable for washing hands is not hot enough to kill bacteria.
targetString: Amanzi ashisayo ongakwazi ukuhlanza ngawo izandla aweshisi ngezinga elifanele ukuze kufe amagciwane.

sourceString: Bacteria grow much faster at body temperature (37 °C).
targetString: Amagciwane akhula kakhulu lapho ukushisa komziba kungu-(37 °C).

sourceString: However, warm, soapy water is more effective than cold, soapy water at removing natural oils which hold soils and bacteria.
targetString: Kodwa, amanzi antukuntuku, anensipho asebenza kangcono kunamanzi abandayo, anensipho ekususeni amafutha emvelo abamba inhlabathi namagciwane.

sourceString: Contrary to popular belief however, scientific studies have shown that using warm water has no effect on reducing the microbial load on hands.
targetString: Ngokuhlukile kokukholelwa inqwaba kodwa, ucwaningo lososayensi lubonisile ukuthi ukusebenzisa amanzi afudumele akunamthelela ekunciphiseni i-microbial load ezandleni.

sourceString: A hand sanitizer or hand antiseptic is a non-water-based hand hygiene agent.
targetString: I-hand sanitizer noma i-hand antiseptic iyisimeleli senhlanzeko yezandla esingenziwe ngamanzi.

sourceString: In the late 1990s and early part of the 21st century, alcohol rub non-water-based hand hygiene agents (also known as alcohol-based hand rubs, antiseptic hand rubs, or hand sanitizers) began to gain popularity.
targetString: Ekupheleni kwama-1990s futhi ekuqaleni kwengxenye lekhulu leminyaka ka-21, izimeleli zenhlanzeko yezandla ezingenziwe ngamanzi ezihlikihla nge-alcohol (zibuye zaziwe ngokuthi ama-alcohol-based hand rubs, ama-antiseptic hand rubs, noma ama-hand sanitizers) aqala ukuthola ukuduma.

sourceString: Most are based on isopropyl alcohol or ethanol formulated together with a thickening agent such as Carbomer (polymer of acrylic acid) into a gel, or a humectant such as glycerin into a liquid, or foam for ease of use and to decrease the drying effect of the alcohol.
targetString: Amaningi asekelwe ku-isopropyl alcohol noma i-ethanol eyakhuwe yahlanganiswa ngesimeleli esishubisayo njenge-Carbomer (i-polymer of acrylic acid) yenze kube ijeli, noma i-humectant njenge-glycerin ibe uketshezi, noma igwebu ukuze kube lula ukusebenzisa nokunciphisa isimo sokoma se-alcohol.

sourceString: Adding diluted hydrogen-peroxide increases further  the antimicrobial activity.Hand sanitizers containing a minimum of 60 to 95% alcohol are efficient germ killers.
targetString: Ukufaka i'-hydrogen-peroxide efakwe uketshezi kuphakamisa nakakhulu i-antimicrobial activity. Ama-hand sanitizers ane-alcohol engu-60 to 95% abulala amagciwane ngempumelelo.

sourceString: Alcohol rub sanitizers kill bacteria, multi-drug resistant bacteria (MRSA and VRE), tuberculosis, and some viruses (including HIV, herpes, RSV, rhinovirus, vaccinia, influenza, and hepatitis) and fungi.
targetString: Ama-alcohol rub sanitizers abulala amagciwane, ama-multi-drug resistant bacteria (i-MRSA ne-VRE), i-tuberculosis, namnye amagciwane (kuhlanganisa i-HIV, ama-herpes, i-RSV, i-rhinovirus, i-vaccinia, i-influenza, ne-hepatitis) ne-fungi.

sourceString: Alcohol rub sanitizers containing 70% alcohol kill 99.97% (3.5 log reduction, similar to 35 decibel reduction) of the bacteria on hands 30 seconds after application and 99.99% to 99.999% (4 to 5 log reduction) of the bacteria on hands 1 minute after application.Hand sanitizers are most effective against bacteria and less effective against some viruses.
targetString: Ama-alcohol rub sanitizers ane-70% ye-alcohol abulala u-99.97% (u-3.5 log ngokuncipha, ngokufanayo no-35 decibel ngokuncipha) wamagciwane ezandleni ngemizuzwana engu-30 ngemuva kokugcoba no-99.99% kuye ku-99.999% (4 kuya ku-5 log ngokuncipha) kwamagciwane ezandleni umzuzu ongu-1 ngemuva kokugcoba. Ama-hand sanitizers asebenza kahle kumagciwane futhi asebenze kancane kumagciwane athile.

sourceString: Alcohol-based hand sanitizers are almost entirely ineffective against norovirus (or Norwalk) type viruses, the most common cause of contagious gastroenteritis.Enough hand antiseptic or alcohol rub must be used to thoroughly wet or cover both hands.
targetString: Ama-hand sanitizers enziwe nge-alcohol acishe angasebenzi nhlobo ku-norovirus (noma i-Norwalk) uhlobo lwmagciwane, imbangela eyinhloko ye-gastroenteritis ethelelanayo. I-hand antiseptic eyanele noma i-alcohol rub kumele isebenziswe ukuthi imazise ngokuphelele noma imboze zombili izandla.

sourceString: The front and back of both hands and between and the ends of all fingers are rubbed for approximately 30 seconds until the liquid, foam or gel is dry.
targetString: Ingaphambili nengemuva lazo zombili izandla nangaphakathi nasekugcineni kweminwe kuyahlikihlwa cishe imizuzwana engu-30 kuze kube yilapho uketshezi, igwebu noma ijeli isiyomile.

sourceString: Finger tips must be washed well too, rubbing them in both palms.The US Center for Disease Control and Prevention recommends hand washing over hand sanitizer rubs, particularly when hands are visibly dirty.
targetString: Izingcina zeminwe kumele zihlanzwe nazo, zihlikihlwe ezintendeni zombili. I-The US Center for Disease Control and Prevention ikhuthaza ukuhlanza izandla kunokuhlikihla ngama-hand sanitizer, ikhakhulukazi lapho kusobala ukuthi izandla zingclolile.

sourceString: The increasing use of these agents is based on their ease of use and rapid killing activity against micro-organisms; however, they should not serve as a replacement for proper hand washing unless soap and water are unavailable.
targetString: Ukuphakama ekusebenziseni lezi zimeleli kungenxa kokusenza kwazo okulula namandla okushesha ukubulala ama-micro-organisms; kodwa, okufanele zisebeniswe ukuze zithathe indawo yokuhlanza izandla efanele ngaphandle kwalapho insipho namanzi kungatholakali.

sourceString: Frequent use of alcohol-based hand sanitizers can cause dry skin unless emollients and/or skin moisturizers are added to the formula.
targetString: Ukusebenzisa njalo ama-hand sanitizers asekelwe ku-alcohol kungenza isikhumba ngaphandle kwalapho ama-emollients noma/iziswakamisi zesikhumba zifakiwe ekuhlanganiseni.

sourceString: The drying effect of alcohol can be reduced or eliminated by adding glycerin and/or other emollients to the formula.
targetString: Inqubo yokoma kuka-alcohol kunganciphiswa noma kuqedwe ngokufaka i-glycerin ne-/noma nama-emollients ekuhlanganiseni.

sourceString: In clinical trials, alcohol-based hand sanitizers containing emollients caused substantially less skin irritation and dryness than soaps or antimicrobial detergents.
targetString: Ekuhloleni kokwelapha, ama-hand sanitizers asekelwe ku-alcohol anama-emollients enza ukulunyelwa kwesikhumba okwehle kakhulu nokoma kunensipho noma izihlanzi ezine-antimicrobial.

sourceString: Allergic contact dermatitis, contact urticaria syndrome or hypersensitivity to alcohol or additives present in alcohol hand rubs rarely occur.
targetString: I-Allergic contact dermatitis, i-contact urticaria syndrome noma i- hypersensitivity to alcohol noma ama-additives akhona kuma-alcohol hand rubs awavamile ukuba khona.

sourceString: The lower tendency to induce irritant contact dermatitis became an attraction as compared to soap and water hand washing.
targetString: Isimo esiphansi sokubangela i-irritant contact dermatitis sibe okukhangayo uma kuqhathaniswa nokuhlanza izandla ngensipho namanzi.

sourceString: Despite their effectiveness, non-water agents do not cleanse the hands of organic material, but simply disinfect them.
targetString: Kungakhathaliseki ukusebenza kwawo, izimeleli ezingenamanzi azikwazi ukuhlanza izandla ezintweni zembelo, kodwa ukuzibulala amagciwane nje.

sourceString: It is for this reason that hand sanitizers are not as effective as soap and water at preventing the spread of many pathogens, since the pathogens still remain on the hands.
targetString: Kungalesi sizathu ukuthi ama-hand sanitizers awasebenzi kahle njengensipho namanzi ekuvikeleni ukusabalala kwama-pathogens amaningi, njengoba ama-pathogens eqhubeka esezandleni.

sourceString: Alcohol-free hand sanitizer efficacy is heavily dependent on the ingredients and formulation, and historically has significantly under-performed alcohol and alcohol rubs.
targetString: Ukuphumelela kwama-hand sanitizer angenayo i-alcohol kuncike kakhulu ezithakweni nokuhlanganiswa, futhi ngokomlando asebenza ngokuphoxayo kune-alcohol nama-alcohol rubs.

sourceString: More recently, formulations that use benzalkonium chloride have been shown to have persistent and cumulative antimicrobial activity after application, unlike alcohol, which has been shown to decrease in efficacy after repeated use, probably due to progressive adverse skin reactions.
targetString: Muva nje, ukuhlanganisa okusebenzisa i-benzalkonium chloride kubonise ukuphikelela nokwanda kwe-antimicrobial activity ngemuva kokugcoba, ngokungafani ne-alcohol, esibonisiwe ukuthi yehla izinga lokusebenza ngemuka kokusebenza ngokuphindwa, kungenzeka ingesizathu sokusabela okuqhubekayo kwesikhumba.

sourceString: Many people in low-income communities cannot afford soap and use ash or soil instead.
targetString: Abantu abaning emiphakathini entulayo kwezemali abakwazi ukukhona insipho futhi basebenzisa umlotha noma inhlabathi esikhundleni.

sourceString: Ash or soil may be more effective than water alone, but may be less effective than soap.
targetString: Umlotha noma inhlabathi ingase isebenze kangcono kunamanzi kuphela, kodwa isebenze kancane kunensipho.

sourceString: One concern is that if the soil or ash is contaminated with microorganisms it may increase the spread of disease rather than decrease it.
targetString: Okukodwa okukhathazayo ukuthi uma inhlabathi noma umlotha uthole ukugcola kwama-micro-organisms kungase kuphakamise ukusabalala kwesifo kunokusinciphisa.

sourceString: Like soap, ash is also a disinfecting agent because in contact with water, it forms an alkaline solution.
targetString: Njengensipho, umlotha nawo uyisimeleli esiqeda igciwane ngoba lapho uhlanganiswa namanzi, kudaleka ingxube ye-alkaline.

sourceString: WHO recommended ash or sand as alternative to soap when soap is not available.
targetString: I-WHO ikhuthaza umlotha noma isihlabathi esikhundleni sensipho uma insipho ingatholakali.

sourceString: Correct handwashing technique recommended by the US Centers for Disease Control  for prevention of transmission of disease includes the following steps:
targetString: Inqubo efanele yokuhlanza izandla ekhuthanwa i-US Centers for Disease Control  for prevention of transmission of disease ihlanganisa lezi zinyathelo:

sourceString: Wet hands with warm or cold running water.
targetString: Matisa izandla ngamanzi ahambayo afudumele noma abandayo.

sourceString: Running water is recommended because standing basins may be contaminated, while the temperature of the water does not seem to make a difference.
targetString: Amanzi ahambayo ayakhuthazwa ngoba obheseni abamile kungenzeka babe nokungcola, kanti isimo sokubanda noma sokushisa samanzi asibonisi senza umehluko.

sourceString: Lather hands by rubbing them with a generous amount of soap, including the backs of hands, between fingers, and under nails.
targetString: Gcoba izandla ngokuzihlikihla ngensipho eyanele kahle, ukhanganise ingemuva lezandla, phakathi neminwe, nangaphansi kwezinzipho.

sourceString: Soap lifts germs from the skin, and studies show that people tend to wash their hands more thoroughly when soap is used rather than water alone.
targetString: Insipho iphakamisa amagciwane esikhumbeni, fithi ucwaningo lubonisa ukuthi abantu bavame ukuhlanza izandla zabo kakhle uma insipho ikhona kunalapho besebenzisa amanzi kuphela.

sourceString: Scrub for at least 20 seconds.
targetString: Skrabha okungenani imizuzwana engu-20.

sourceString: Scrubbing creates friction, which helps remove germs from skin, and scrubbing for longer periods removes more germs.
targetString: Ukuskrabha kubangela ukushisa, okusizayo ekususeni amagciwane esikhumbeni, futhi ukuskrabha inkathi ende kususa amagciwane engeziwe.

sourceString: Rinse well under running water.
targetString: Hlambulula kahle ngaphansi kwamanzi ahambayo.

sourceString: Rinsing in a basin can recontaminate hands.
targetString: Ukuhlambulula kubheseni kungase kuzingcolise izandla

sourceString: Dry with a clean towel or allow to air dry.
targetString: Omisa ngethawula elihlanzekile noma uvumele zome ngomoya.

sourceString: Wet and moist hands are more easily recontaminated.The most commonly missed areas are the thumb, the wrist, the areas between the fingers, and under fingernails.
targetString: Izandla ezimanzi neziswakeme zikuthatha kalula ukungcola. Izindawo ezilibaleka kalula isithupha, isihlakalo, izindawo eiphakathi neminwe, nangaphansi kwezinzipho.

sourceString: Artificial nails and chipped nail polish may harbor microorganisms.
targetString: Izinzipho zokufakelwa ne-nail polish edlekile kungaze ama-microorganisms.

sourceString: Moisturizing lotion is often recommended to keep the hands from drying out; dry skin can lead to skin damage which can increase the risk for the transmission of infection.
targetString: Iloshini eswakamisayo ivamile ukukhuthazwa ukuze ugcine izandla zingomile; isikhumba esomile singaholela ekulimaleni kwesikhumba okungaphakamisa ukuchayeka kokudluliselwa isifo.

sourceString: Various low-cost options can be made to facilitate hand washing where tap-water and/or soap is not available e.g. pouring water from a hanging jerrycan or gourd with suitable holes and/or using ash if needed in developing countries.In situations with limited water supply (such as schools or rural areas in developing countries), there are water-conserving solutions, such as "tippy-taps" and other low-cost options.
targetString: Izinhlelo ezihlukile ezingabizi zingenziwa ukukuze kuhlangabezwe ukuhlanza izandla lapho amanzi ompompi kanye/noma insipho kungatholakali isib. ukuthela amanzi ngokulengisa isitsha noma isigubhu esinezimbobo ezifanele kanye/noma usebenzise umlotha uma kudingeka emazweni asathuthuka. Ezimweni ezinamanzi alinganiselwe (njengezikole noma izindawo zasemaphandleni emazweni asathuthuka), kunezinqubo eziyisixazulo zokonga amanzi, njengama-"tippy-taps" nezinye izinhlobo zokonga imali.

sourceString: A tippy-tap is a simple technology using a jug suspended by a rope, and a foot-operated lever to pour a small amount of water over the hands and a bar of soap.
targetString: I-tippy-tap ubuchwepheshe obulula bokusebenzisa isigubhu esiboshwe ngentambo, nesigwedlo esisebenza ngonyawo esithela amanzi amancane ezandleni neqhuzu lensipho.

sourceString: Effective drying of the hands is an essential part of the hand hygiene process, but there is some debate over the most effective form of drying in public washrooms.
targetString: Ukomisa okusebenzayo kwezandla kuyingxenye ebalulekile kwenqubo yenhlanzeko yezandla,kodwa kunokuphikisana mayelana nendlela esebenza ngcono yokomisa ezindaweni zokuhlanza zomphakathi.

sourceString: A growing volume of research suggests paper towels are much more hygienic than the electric hand dryers found in many washrooms.
targetString: Umqingo owandayo wocwaningo uphakamisa ukuthi amathawula ephepha angcono ngokuhlanzeka kunezomisi zomoya zikagesi ezitholakala ezindaweni zokuhlanza.

sourceString: In 2008, a study was conducted by the University of Westminster, London, and sponsored by the paper-towel industry the European Tissue Symposium, to compare the levels of hygiene offered by paper towels, warm-air hand dryers and the more modern jet-air hand dryers.
targetString: Ngo-2008, ucwaningo olwaluqondiswa i-University of Westminster, London, futhi elalixhaswe imboni yamathawula ephepha i-European Tissue Symposium, ukuthi iqhathanise amazinga enhlanzeko atholakala kumathawula ephepha, izomisi zezandla zomoya oshisayo nezomisi zezandla zamuva zomoya osheshayo.

sourceString: After washing and drying hands with the warm-air dryer, the total number of bacteria was found to increase on average on the finger pads by 194% and on the palms by 254%.
targetString: Ngemuva kokuhlanza nokomisa izandla ngesomisi somoya oshisayo, ingqikithi yesibalo samagciwane satholakala siphakama ngesilinganiso kumaphedi eminwe ngo-194% futhi ematheni esandla ngo-254%.

sourceString: Drying with the jet-air dryer resulted in an increase on average of the total number of bacteria on the finger pads by 42% and on the palms by 15%.
targetString: Ukomisa ngesomisi somoya osheshayo kwaphumelela ekuphakameni ngesilinganiso sengqikithi yesibalo samagciwane kumaphedi eminwe ngo-42% futhi ematheni esandla ngo-15%.

sourceString: After washing and drying hands with a paper towel, the total number of bacteria was reduced on average on the finger pads by up to 76% and on the palms by up to 77%.The scientists also carried out tests to establish whether there was the potential for cross contamination of other washroom users and the washroom environment as a result of each type of drying method.
targetString: Ngemuva kokuhlanza nokomisa izandla ngethawula lephepha, ingqikithi yesibalo segciwane yehla ngesilinganiso kumaphedi eminwe ngo-76% futhi ematheni esandla ngokufifa ku-77%. Ososayensi baphinda bathatha ukuhlola okungaveza uma belikhona ithuba lokuthelelana kwabasenzisi bezindawo zokuhlanza nendawo yokuhlanza njengomphumela wendlela ngayinye yokomisa.

sourceString: The jet-air dryer, which blows air out of the unit at claimed speeds of 180 m/s (650 km/h; 400 mph), was capable of blowing micro-organisms from the hands and the unit and potentially contaminating other washroom users and the washroom environment up to 2 metres away.
targetString: Isomisi somoya osheshayo, esiphephetha umoya ovela kuso ngesivinini esibekiwe sika-180 m/s (650 km/h; 400 mph), saphumelela ukuphephetha ama-micro-organisms esandleni nakuso nokucishe sithelele abanye abasebenzisi nendawo yokuhlanza ibanga elingaba amamitha angu-2.

sourceString: Use of a warm-air hand dryer spread micro-organisms up to 0.25 metres from the dryer.
targetString: Ukusebenziswa komoya oshisayo kwasabalalisa ama-micro-organisms kuze kube amamitha angu-0.25 kusuka kwisomisi.

sourceString: Paper towels showed no significant spread of micro-organisms.In 2005, in a study conducted by TÜV Produkt und Umwelt, different hand drying methods were evaluated.
targetString: Amathawula ephepha awabonisanga kusabalala okuqaphelekayo kwama-micro-organisms. Ngo-2005, ucwaningo olwaqondiswa i-TÜV Produkt und Umwelt, izindlela zokomisa izandla ezihlukile zahlolwa.

sourceString: The following changes in the bacterial count after drying the hands were observed:
targetString: Ushintsho olulandelayo esibalweni samagciwane ngemuva kokomisa izandla kwaqaphelwa:

sourceString: Many different hand dryer manufacturers exist, and hand driers have been compared against drying with paper towels.
targetString: Baningi abakhiqizi bezomisi zezandla abakhona, futhi izimisi zezandla zike zaqhathaniswa nokomisa ngama-paper towels.

sourceString: Hand washing using hand sanitizing wipes is an alternative during traveling in the absence of soap and water.
targetString: Ukuhlanza izandla usebenzisa ama-hand sanitizing asulayo enye indlela lapho usohambweni ingenkho insipho namanzi.

sourceString: Alcohol-based hand sanitizer should contain at least 60% alcohol.
targetString: I-hand sanitizer eyakhiwe nge-alcohol kumele ibe ne-alcohol ngu-60% okungenani.

sourceString: Medical hand-washing became mandatory long after Hungarian physician Ignaz Semmelweis discovered its effectiveness (in 1846) in preventing disease in a hospital environment.
targetString: Ukuhlanza izandla kwezokwelapha kwaphoqelelwa isikhathi eside ngemuva kokuthi udokotela wase-Hungary u-Ignaz Semmelweis ethole ukusebenza kwakho (ngo-1846) ekuvikeleni isifo endaweni yasesibhedlela.

sourceString: There are electronic devices that provide feedback to remind hospital staff to wash their hands when they forget.
targetString: Kunamadivayisi asebenza ngogesi ahlinzekela ngokuphawula okukhumbuza izisebenzi zasesibhedlela ukuthi zihlanze izandla lapho zikhohlwa.

sourceString: One study has found decreased infection rates with their use.
targetString: Ucwaningo olulodwa luthole ukuncipha kwamazinga ezifo ngokusebenza kwawo.

sourceString: Medical hand-washing is for a minimum of 15 seconds, using generous amounts of soap and water or gel to lather and rub each part of the hands.
targetString: Ukuhlanza izandla kwezokwelapha kuba imizuzwana engu-15, usebenzisa insipho eningi namanzi noma ijeli ukuze ugcobe noma uhlikihle ingxenye ngayinye yezandla.

sourceString: Hands should be rubbed together with digits interlocking.
targetString: Izandla kumelwe zihlikihlwe ndawonye ngokugaxelanisa iminwe.

sourceString: If there is debris under fingernails, a bristle brush may be used to remove it.
targetString: Uma kunokungcola ngaphansi kwezinzipho, i-bristle brush ingasebenziswa ukuze ikususe.

sourceString: Since germs may remain in the water on the hands, it is important to rinse well and wipe dry with a clean towel.
targetString: Njengoba amagciwane engahlala emanzini asezandleni, kubalulekile ukuhlambulula kahle bese usula kome ngethawula elihlanzekile.

sourceString: After drying, the paper towel should be used to turn off the water (and open any exit door if necessary).
targetString: Ngemuva kokomisa, ithawula lephepha kumele libenziswe ukuvala amanzi (nokuvula noma isiphi isicabha sokuphuma uma kwenzeka).

sourceString: This avoids re-contaminating the hands from those surfaces.
targetString: Lokhu kugwema ukuphinde ungcolise izandla ngalezo zindawo.

sourceString: The purpose of hand-washing in the health-care setting is to remove pathogenic microorganisms ("germs") and avoid transmitting them.
targetString: Inhloso yokuhlanza izandla esimweni sokwezokunakekela ukususa ama-pathogenic microorganisms ("germs") bese ugwema ukuwadlulisela.

sourceString: The New England Journal of Medicine reports that a lack of hand-washing remains at unacceptable levels in most medical environments, with large numbers of doctors and nurses routinely forgetting to wash their hands before touching patients, thus transmitting microorganisms.
targetString: I-The New England Journal of Medicine ibika ukuthi ukuyekelela ukuhlanza izandla kuqhubeka ngamazinga angemukeleki ezindaweni eziningi zezokwelapha, isibalo esikhulu sodokotela nabahlengikazi beqhubeka bekhohlwa ukuhlanza izandla zabo ngaphambi kokuthinta iziguli, kanjalo badlulisele ama-microorganisms.

sourceString: One study showed that proper hand-washing and other simple procedures can decrease the rate of catheter-related bloodstream infections by 66 percent.The World Health Organization has published a sheet demonstrating standard hand-washing and hand-rubbing in health-care sectors.
targetString: Ucwaningo olulodwa lwabonisa ukuthi ukuhlanza izandla ngendlela nezinye izinqubo ezilula kungehlisa izinga le-catheter-related bloodstream infections ngo-66 percent. I-World Health Organization inyathelise ishidi elibonisa aisimiso sokuhlanza izandla nokuhlikihla izandla emkhakheni wokunakekela kwezempilo.

sourceString: The draft guidance of hand hygiene by the organization can also be found at its website for public comment.
targetString: Iziqondiso zenhlangano ezisalungiswa zenhlanzeko yezandla zingatholakala kuwebusayithi yayo ukuze umphakathi uphawule.

sourceString: A relevant review was conducted by Whitby et al.
targetString: Ukubuyekeza okufanele kwaqondiswa i-Whitby et al.

sourceString: Commercial devices can measure and validate hand hygiene, if demonstration of regulatory compliance is required.
targetString: Amadivayisi ezitolo angakwazi ukulinganisa nokuqinisekisa inhlanzeko yezandla, uma ukubonisa nokuvumelana nomthetho kuyafuneka.

sourceString: The World Health Organization has "Five Moments" for washing hands:
targetString: I-World Health Organization ine-"zikhathi eziyisihlanu" zokuhlanza izandla:

sourceString: after exposure to blood/body fluids
targetString: ngemuva kokuchayeka egazini/kuketshezi lwegazi

sourceString: before an aseptic task, and
targetString: ngaphambi komsebenzi we-aseptic, futhi

sourceString: after patient care.The addition of antiseptic chemicals to soap ("medicated" or "antimicrobial" soaps) confers killing action to a hand-washing agent.
targetString: ngemuva kokunakekela isiguli. Ukufaka amakhemikhali anqandayo ensiphweni ("enomuthi" noma izinsipho "ezinqanda ama-microbes") kunika amandla okubulala kulokho kokuhlanza izandla.

sourceString: Such killing action may be desired prior to performing surgery or in settings in which antibiotic-resistant organisms are highly prevalent.To 'scrub' one's hands for a surgical operation, it is necessary to have a tap that can be turned on and off without touching it with the hands, some chlorhexidine or iodine wash, sterile towels for drying the hands after washing, and a sterile brush for scrubbing and another sterile instrument for cleaning under the fingernails.
targetString: Lawo mandla okubulala angase adingeke ngaphambi komsebenzi wokuhlinza noma ezimweni lapho ama-antibiotic-resistant organisms emaningi khona. Uku-'sikrabha' izandla kothile ngenjongo yomsebenzi wokuhlinza, kuyadingeka ukuba nompompi ongavulwa futhi uvalwe ngaphandle kokuwuthinta ngezandla, i-chlorhexidine noma i-iodine wash, ama-sterile towels okomisa izandla ngemuva kokuhlanza, ne-sterile brush yokusikrabha kanye nenye i-sterile instrument yokuhlanza ngaphansi kwezinzipho.

sourceString: All jewelry should be removed.
targetString: Konke okokuhloba kumele kukhumulwe.

sourceString: This procedure requires washing the hands and forearms up to the elbow, usually 2–6 minutes.
targetString: Lenqubo ifuna ukhlanza izandla nezingalo kufike endololwaneni, ngokuvamile imizuzu engu-2-6.

sourceString: Long scrub-times (10 minutes) are not necessary.
targetString: Izikhathi ezinde zokuskrabha (imizuzu engu-10) azisona isidingo.

sourceString: When rinsing, water on the forearms must be prevented from running back to the hands.
targetString: Lapho uyakaza, amanzi asezingalweni kumele avinjwe angagijimeli emuva ezandleni.

sourceString: After hand-washing is completed, the hands are dried with a sterile cloth and a surgical gown is donned.
targetString: Ngemuva kokuphetha ukuhlanza izandla, izandla zomiswa ngendwangu e-sterile noma ingubo yokuhlinza iyagqokwa.

sourceString: To reduce the spread of germs, it is better to wash the hands or use a hand antiseptic before and after tending to a sick person.
targetString: Ukuze kwehliswe ukusabalala kwagciwane, kungcono ukuhlanza izandla noma ukusebenzisa isinqandamagciwane sezandla ngaphambili nangemuva kokunakekela umuntu ogulayo.

sourceString: For control of staphylococcal infections in hospitals, it has been found that the greatest benefit from hand-cleansing came from the first 20% of washing, and that very little additional benefit was gained when hand cleansing frequency was increased beyond 35%.
targetString: Ukuze kulawulwe izifo ze-staphylococcal ezibhedlela, kuye kwatholakala ukuthi inzuzo enkulu evela ezandleni ezicocekile ivela ku-20% wokuqala wokuhlanza, nokuthi incane kakhulu izuzo eyengeziwe etholakalayo lapho ukuhlanza izandla ngokuphindelela kukhushulwe ngaphezulu kuka-35%.

sourceString: Washing with plain soap results in more than triple the rate of bacterial infectious disease transmitted to food as compared to washing with antibacterial soap.Comparing hand-rubbing with alcohol-based solution with hand washing with antibacterial soap for a median time of 30 seconds each showed that the alcohol hand-rubbing reduced bacterial contamination 26% more than the antibacterial soap.
targetString: Ukuhlanza ngensipho engenalutho kuba nomphumela wezinga elengezwe kathathu lesifo segciwane elithathelanayo ekudleni uma kuqhathaniswa nokuhlanza ngensipho enqanda amagciwane. Ukuqhathanisa i-hand-rubbing nge-alcohol-based solution ne-hand washing with antibacterial soap for a median time of 30 seconds each showed that the alcohol hand-rubbing reduced bacterial contamination 26% more than the antibacterial soap.

sourceString: But soap and water is more effective than alcohol-based hand rubs for reducing H1N1 influenza A virus and Clostridium difficile spores from hands.Interventions to improve hand hygiene in healthcare settings can involve education for staff on hand washing, increasing the availability of alcohol-based hand rub, and written and verbal reminders to staff.
targetString: Kodwa insipho namanzi kusebenza kangcono kunama-alcohol-based hand rubs ekunciphiseni i-H1N1 influenza A virus ne-Clostridium difficile spores ezandleni. Ukungenela ukuze kuthuthukiswe inhlanzeko yezandla ezimweni zokunakekela impilo kungahlanganisa ukufundisa izisebenzi ngokuhlanza izandla, ukuphakamisa ukutholakala kwe-alcohol-based hand rub, nezikhumbuzo ezibhaliwe nezishiwoyo kubasebenzi.

sourceString: There is a need for more research into which of these interventions are most effective in different healthcare settings.
targetString: Kunesidingo socwaningo olwengeziwe oluphenya ukuthi iyiphi kulezindlela zokungenela esebenza kangcono ezimweni zokunakekela impilo ezingafani.

sourceString: In developing countries, hand washing with soap is recognized as a cost-effective, essential tool for achieving good health, and even good nutrition.
targetString: Emazweni asathuthuka, ukuhlanza izandla ngensipho kuqashelwa njengendlela eyongayo, ithuluzi elibalulekile lokufinyelela impilo enhle, ngisho nokondleka ngomzimba.

sourceString: However, a lack of reliable water supply, soap or hand washing facilities in people's homes, at schools and at the workplace make it a challenge to achieve universal hand washing behaviors.
targetString: Kodwa, ukuntuleka kokuphakelwa amanzi okunokuthenjelwa, insipho noma izindawo zokuhlanza izandla emakhaya abantu, ezikoleni nasezindaweni zokusebenza zenza kube inselele ukufinyelela imikhuba yokuhlanza izandla yomhlaba.

sourceString: For example, in most of rural Africa hand washing taps close to every private or public toilet are scarce, even though cheap options exist to build hand washing stations.
targetString: Ngokwesibonelo, emaphandleni amaningi e-Africa imimpompi yokuhlanza izandla eseduze nezindlu zangasese zomuntu noma zomphakhathi iyantuleka, yize zikhona izindlela ezingaduli zokwakha izindawo zokuhlanza izandla.

sourceString: However, low hand washing rates rather can also be the result of engrained habits rather than due to a lack of soap or water.
targetString: Kodwa, amazinga aphansi okuhlanza izandla kungenzeka ayisizathu semikhuba egxilile kunaleso sokuntuleka kwensipho noma kwamanzi.

sourceString: The promotion and advocacy of hand washing with soap can influence policy decisions, raise awareness about the benefits of hand washing and lead to long-term behavior change of the population.
targetString: Ukukhangisa nokumelela ukuhlanza izandla ngensipho kungaba nomthelela ekwenzeni iziqumo zomthetho, kuphakamise ukuqapha ngezinzuzo zokuhlanza izandla futhi kuholele ekushintsheni kwemikhuba ehlalayo yomphakathi.

sourceString: For this to work effectively, monitoring and evaluation are necessary.
targetString: Ukuze lokhu kusebenze kahle, ukuqapha nokulandelela kubalulekile.

sourceString: A systematic review of 70 studies found that community-based approaches are effective at increasing hand washing in LMICs, while social marketing campaigns are less effective.One example for hand washing promotion in schools is the "Three Star Approach" by UNICEF that encourages schools to take simple, inexpensive steps to ensure that students wash their hands with soap, among other hygienic requirements.
targetString: Ukubuyekeza okuhleliwe kocwaningo olungu-70 kuthole ukuthi izindlela ezincika emphakathini ziyasebenza ekuphakamiseni ukuhlanza izandla kuma-LMICs, kuyilapho imikhankaso yokukukhangisa ngokwezenhlalo kusebenza kancane. Isibonelo esisodwa sokukhangisa ukuhlanza izandla ezikoleni "Indlela Yezinkanyezi Ezintathu" ye-UNICEF ekhuthaza izikole ukuthi zithathe izinyathelo ezilula , ezongayo ukuze kuqinisekwe ukuthi abafundi bahlanza izandla zabo ngensipho, phakathi nezinye izimfuneko zenhlanzeko.

sourceString: When minimum standards are achieved, schools can move from one to ultimately three stars.
targetString: Lapho amazinga amancane efinyelelwa, izikole zingasuka kwesinye futhi ekugcineni ziye kwezintathu izinkanyezi.

sourceString: Building hand washing stations can be a part of hand washing promotion campaigns that are carried out in order to reduce diseases and child mortality.
targetString: Ukwakha izindawo zokuhlanza izandla kungaba yingxenye yemikhankaso yokukhangisa ukuhlanza izandla eyenziwayo ukuze kunciphiswe izifo nokufa kwezinsana.

sourceString: Global Hand washing Day is another example of an awareness-raising campaign that is trying to achieve behavior change.As a result of the 2019-20 coronavirus pandemic, UNICEF promoted the adoption of a handwashing emoji.
targetString: Usuku Lomhlaba lokuhlanza Izandla enye yezibonelo yemikhankaso ephakamisa ukuqapha ezama ukufinyelela ukushintsha kwemikhuba. Njengomphumela wobhubhane lwe-2019-20 coronavirus, i-UNICEF yakhangisa ukusebenziswa kabanzi kwe-emoji yokuhlanz'izandla.

sourceString: Few studies have considered the overall cost effectiveness of hand washing in developing countries in relationship to DALYs averted.
targetString: Ucwaningo olumbalwa luye lacabangela izindleko zonkana zokusebenza kokuhlanza izandla emazweni asathuthuka nobudlelwano nokuvimba kwe-DALYs.

sourceString: However, one review suggests that promoting hand washing with soap is significantly more cost-effective than other water and sanitation interventions.
targetString: Kodwa, ukubuyekeza okukodwa kuphakamisa ukuthi ukukhangisa ukuhlanza izandla ngenzipho konga izindleko kakhulu kunokunye ukungenelela ngamanzi nokukhuculula.

sourceString: The importance of hand washing for human health – particularly for people in vulnerable circumstances like mothers who had just given birth or wounded soldiers in hospitals – was first recognized in the mid 19th century by two pioneers of hand hygiene: the Hungarian physician Ignaz Semmelweis who worked in Vienna, Austria and Florence Nightingale, the English "founder of modern nursing".
targetString: Ukubaluleka kokuhlanza izandla kwezempilo yomuntu – ikakhulukazi kubantu zbangaphansi kwezimo ezibuthaka njengomame abasanda kubeletha noma amasosha alimele ezibhedlela – kwaqaphelwa okokuqala phakathi lekhulu leminyaka lika-19 ngamavulandlela amabili enhlanzeko yezandla: Udokotela wase-Hungary u-Ignaz Semmelweis owayesebenza e-Vienna, e-Austria no-Florence Nightingale, Ingisi "elasungula ubuhlengikazi besimanje".

sourceString: At that time most people still believed that infections were caused by foul odors called miasmas.
targetString: Ngaleso sikhathi abantu abaningi babesakholelwa ukuthi izifo zibangwa amaphunga amabi ayebizwa ngama-miasmas.

sourceString: In the 1980s, foodborne outbreaks and healthcare-associated infections led the United States Centers for Disease Control and Prevention to more actively promote hand hygiene as an important way to prevent the spread of infection.
targetString: Ngama-1980s, ukuqubuka okuvela ekudleni nezifo ezihlobene nezokwelapha kwaholela i-United States Centers for Disease Control and Prevention ukuthi ikhangise ngokwengeziwe ukuhlanza izandla njengendlela ebalulekile yokuvikela ukusabalala kwesifo.

sourceString: The outbreak of swine flu in 2009 and the COVID-19 pandemic in 2020 led to increased awareness in many countries of the importance of washing hands with soap to protect oneself from such infectious diseases.
targetString: Ukuqubuka kwe-swine flu ngo-2009 kanye nobhubhane lwe-COVID-19 ngo-2020 kuholele ekuqapheni okuphakeme emazweni amaningi mayelana nokubaluleka kokuhlanza izandla ngensipho ukuze umuntu azivikele kuloluhlobo lwezifo ezithathelanayo.

sourceString: For example, posters with "correct hand washing techniques" were hung up next to hand washing sinks in public toilets and in the toilets of office buildings and airports in Germany.
targetString: Ngokwesibonelo, amaphosta anombhalo othi-"inqubo efanele yokuhlanza izandlahand" aphanyekwa phezulu eduze kukasinki wokuhlanza izandla ezindlini zangasese zomphakathi nasezindlini zangasese kumabhilidi amahhovisi nasezikhumulweni zezindiza e-Germany.

sourceString: The phrase "washing one's hands of" something, means declaring one's unwillingness to take responsibility for the thing or share complicity in it.
targetString: Isisho esithi "ukuhlanza izandla zakho" kokuthile, kusho ukucacisa ungafuni kothile ukuthatha umthwalo wemfanelo kokuthile noma ukuhileleka kuyo.

sourceString: It originates from the bible passage in Matthew where Pontius Pilate washed his hands of the decision to crucify Jesus Christ, but has become a phrase with a much wider usage in some English communities.
targetString: Umsuka wayo isiqephu sebhayibheli sikaMathewu lapho u-Pontius Pilate ezihlanza izandla ekwenzeni isinqumo sokubethela u-Jesus Christ, kodwa sesiphenduke isisho esisebenza kabanzi kweminye imiphakathi yamangisi.

sourceString: In Shakespeare's Macbeth, Lady Macbeth begins to compulsively wash her hands in an attempt to cleanse an imagined stain, representing her guilty conscience regarding crimes she had committed and induced her husband to commit.
targetString: Ku-Macbeth ka-Shakespeare, Intokazi u-Macbeth iqala sakuphoqa ngozikuhlanza izandla izama ukuzicoca okungcola okucabangwayo, okumelela unembeza onecala ngokuphathelene namacala ayewenzile futhi wanxenxela umyeni wakhe ukuba awenze.

sourceString: It has also been found that people, after having recalled or contemplated unethical acts, tend to wash hands more often than others, and tend to value hand washing equipment more.
targetString: Kuphinde kwatholakala ukuthi abantu, ngemuva kokukhumbula noma kokucabanga ngezenzo ezingafanele, bavamile ukuhlanza izandla zobo izikhathi eziningana kunabanye, futhi bavamile ukwazisa ukubaluleka kwezinto zokuhlanza izandla kakhudlwana.

sourceString: Furthermore, those who are allowed to wash their hands after such a contemplation are less likely to engage in other "cleansing" compensatory actions, such as volunteering.
targetString: Ngaphezulu kwalokho, lapho abavumelwe ukuhlanza izandla zabo ngemuva kwalokho aba mancane amathuba abo okuhlanganyela kokuzisola ezenzweni "zokuhlanza", njengokuvoluntiya.

sourceString: Religions prescribe hand washing for both hygienic and symbolic purposes.Symbolic hand washing, using water but no soap to wash hands, is a part of ritual hand washing featured in many religions, including Bahá'í Faith, Hinduism, tevilah and netilat yadayim in Judaism, Lavabo in Christianity, and Wudhu in Islam.Religions also prescribe hygienic hand washing, especially after certain actions.
targetString: Inkolo ikhuthaza ukuhlanza izandla ngakho kokubili injongo yenhlanzeko nomfuziselo. Imfuziselo ekuhlanzeni izandla, usebenzisa amanzi kodwa ngaphandle kwensipho ukuze uhlanze izandla, kuyingxenye yenqubo yokuhlanza izandla ekhona kweziningi izinkolo, kuhlanganise i-Bahá'í Faith, i-Hinduism, i-tevilah ne-netilat yadayim ku-Judaism, i-Lavabo ku-Christianity, ne-Wudhu ku-Islam. Izinkolo ziphinde zikhuthaze ukuhlanza izandla, ikakhulukazi ngemuva kwezenzo ezithile.

sourceString: Hinduism, Judaism and Islam mandate washing of hands after using the toilet.
targetString: I-Hinduism, i-Judaism ne-Islam iphoqa ukuhlanzwa kwezandla ngemuva kokusebenzisa indlu yangasese.

sourceString: And, Hinduism, Buddhism, Sikhism, Judaism and Islam mandate washing of hands before and after every meal.
targetString: Futhi, i-Hinduism, i-Buddhism, i-Sikhism, i-Judaism ne-Islam iphoqa ukuhlanza izandla ngaphambili nangemuva kokudla.

sourceString: Impact of the 2019–20 coronavirus pandemic on education
targetString: Umphumela wobhubhane lwe-coronavirus ka-2019–20 kwezemfundo

sourceString: The 2019–20 coronavirus pandemic has affected educational systems worldwide, leading to the widespread closures of schools and universities.
targetString: Ubhubhane lwe-coronavirus ka-2019–20 luthinte izinqubo kwezemfundo umhlaba wonke, okuholele ekuvalweni okwandile kwezikole namanyuvesi.

sourceString: As of 8 April 2020, approximately 1.716 billion learners have been affected due to school closures in response to COVID-19.
targetString: Kusukela ngo-8 April 2020, cishe izinkulungwane zezigidi ezingu- 1.716 zabafundi ziye zathinteka ngenxa yokuvalwa kwezikole njengendlela yokusabela ku-COVID-19.

sourceString: According to UNESCO monitoring, 188 countries have implemented nationwide closures and 5 have implemented local closures, impacting about 99.4%  of the world's student population.
targetString: Ngokusho kokuqapha kuka-UNESCO, amazwe angu-188 aqalise ukuvala kwezwe lonke futhi angu-5 aqalise ukuvala kwasendaweni, okuthinta okungenani u-99.4% wenani labafundi umhlaba wonke.

sourceString: On 23 March 2020, Cambridge International Examinations (CIE) released a statement announcing the cancellation of Cambridge IGCSE, Cambridge O Level, Cambridge International AS & A Level, Cambridge AICE Diploma, and Cambridge Pre-U examinations for the May/June 2020 series across all countries.
targetString: Ngo-23 March 2020, i-Cambridge International Examinations (CIE) yakhipha ukwazisa okumemezela ukukhansela i-Cambridge IGCSE, i-Cambridge O Level, i-Cambridge International AS & A Level, i-Cambridge AICE Diploma, ne-Cambridge Pre-U examinations yohlelo luka-May/June 2020 kuwo onke amazwe.

sourceString: International Baccalaureate exams have also been cancelled.School closures impact not only students, teachers, and families, but have far-reaching economic and societal consequences.
targetString: Ama-International Baccalaureate exams nawo akhanseliwe. Ukuvalwa kwezikole akuthinti abafundi kuphela, othisha, nemikhaya, kodwa kunemiphumela efika kude kwezomnotho nenhlalakahle.

sourceString: School closures in response to COVID-19 have shed light on various social and economic issues, including student debt, digital learning, food insecurity, and homelessness, as well as access to childcare, health care, housing, internet, and disability services.
targetString: Ukuvalwa kwezikole ngenxa ye-COVID-19 kuveze ukukhanya ezinkingeni ezihlukile kwezokuhlala nezomnotho, okuhlanganisa isikweletu sabafundi, ukufunda ngenqubo edijithali, ukungalondeki kokudla, ukungabi nakhaya, kanjalo nokufinyelela inhlalakahle yabantwana, ezezempilo, ezokuhlala, i-inthanethi, nemisebenzi yabakhubazekile.

sourceString: The impact was more severe for disadvantaged children and their families, causing interrupted learning, compromised nutrition, childcare problems, and consequent economic cost to families who could not work.In response to school closures, UNESCO recommended the use of distance learning programmes and open educational applications and platforms that schools and teachers can use to reach learners remotely and limit the disruption of education.
targetString: Umphumela waba nzima ezinganeni nemikhaya yazo engamile kahle kwezomnotho, kwadala ukuphazamisa ukufunda, kwalulaza ukondleka, izinkinga zokunakekela abantwana, nemiphumela yezindleko zomnotho emikhayeni engakwazanga ukusebenza. Isabela ekuvalweni kwezikole, i-UNESCO ikhuthaze ukusebenziswa kwezinqubo zokufundela emakhaya nokuvulwa kwama-applications ezemfundo nama-platforms izikole nothisha abangakusebenzisa ukufinyelela abafundi bekude futhi kukhawulwe ukuphazamiswa kwezemfundo.

sourceString: Efforts to stem the spread of COVID-19 through non-pharmaceutical interventions and preventive measures such as social-distancing and self-isolation have prompted the widespread closure of primary, secondary, and tertiary schooling in over 100 countries.Previous outbreaks of infectious diseases have prompted widespread school closings around the world, with varying levels of effectiveness.
targetString: Imizamo yokumisa ukusabalala kwe COVID-19 ngokusebenzisa izindlela zokungenela ngaphandle kwemithi nezinyathelo zokuvikela njengokuzihlukanisa ngokuhlala nokuzivalela ziholele ukuvalwa kwamabanga aphansi, amabanga aphakeme, nezikole zemfundo ephakeme emazweni angaphezulu kuka 100. Ukukubuka kwesikhathi esidlule kwezifo ezithelelanayo kwaqalisa ukuvalwa kwezikole okwandile emhlabeni wonke, kuye ngokushiyana kwemiphumela.

sourceString: Mathematical modelling has shown that transmission of an outbreak may be delayed by closing schools.
targetString: Isifanekiso sezibalo sibosa ukuthi ukudliliselana kokuqubuka kugase kwenziwe kuphuze ngokuvala izikole.

sourceString: However, effectiveness depends on the contacts children maintain outside of school.
targetString: Kodwa, ukuphumelela kuncika kulabo izingane eziqhubeka zithintana nabo ngaphandle kwesikole.

sourceString: School closures may be effective when enacted promptly.
targetString: Ukuvala izikole kungase kuphumelele uma kwenziwe ngokushesha.

sourceString: If school closures occur late relative to an outbreak, they are less effective and may not have any impact at all.
targetString: Uma izikole zivala sekuphuzile ngokuqhathaniswa nokuqubuka, akubi nomphumela omuhle futhi kungase kungaphi namphumela nhlobo.

sourceString: Additionally, in some cases, the reopening of schools after a period of closure has resulted in increased infection rates.
targetString: Ngaphezulu kwalokho, kwezinye izimo, ukuvula izikole ngemuva kwenkathi yokuvala kuphumelele ekuphakameni kwamazinga okutheleleka.

sourceString: As closures tend to occur concurrently with other interventions such as public gathering bans, it can be difficult to measure the specific impact of school closures.During the 1918-1919 influenza pandemic in the United States, school closures and public gathering bans were associated with lower total mortality rates.
targetString: Njengoba ukuvalwa kuvame ukwenzeka kuhambisana nezinye izindlela zokungenelela njengokuvalwa kokuhlangana emphakathini, kungase kube nzima ukulinganisa umphumela oqondile wokuvala izikole. Phakathi nobhubhane lwe-influenza ka-1918-1919 e-United States, ukuvalwa kwezikole nokuvalwa kokubuthana komphakathi kwahlobaniswa namazinga aphansi okufa.

sourceString: Cities that implemented such interventions earlier had greater delays in reaching peak mortality rates.
targetString: Amadolobha aqalise ukungenelela okunjalo kusenesikhathi aba nokuphuza okukhulu kokufinyelela amazinga okufa aphakeme.

sourceString: Schools closed for a median duration of 4 weeks according to a study of 43 US cities' response to the Spanish Flu.
targetString: Izikole zavala isikhashana samaviki angu-4 ngokusho kocwaningo lwamadolobha angu-43 ase-US ayesabela ku-Spanish Flu.

sourceString: School closures were shown to reduce morbidity from the Asian flu by 90% during the 1957–58 outbreak, and up to 50% in controlling influenza in the US, 2004–2008.Multiple countries successfully slowed the spread of infection through school closures during the 2009 H1N1 Flu pandemic.
targetString: Ukuvala kwezikole kwabonisa kwehlisa ukuqothula kwe-Asian flu ngo-90% phakathi nokuqubuka kuka-1957–58, futhi ku-50% ekulawuleni i-influenzae-US, 2004–2008. Amazwe amaningi akwazile ukunensisa ngempumelelo ukusabalala kokutheleleka ngokuvala izikole phakathi nobhubhane lango-2009 lwe-H1N1 Flu.

sourceString: School closures in the city of Oita, Japan, were found to have successfully decreased the number of infected students at the peak of infection; however closing schools was not found to have significantly decreased the total number of infected students.
targetString: Ukuvalwa kwezikole edolobheni lase-Oita, e-Japan, kwatholakala kuphumelele ekunciphiseni ngempumelelo isibalo sabafundi abathelelekile ekuphakameni kwesifo; kodwa ukuvala izikole akuzange kutholakale kunciphisa ngezinga elikhulu ingqikithi yesibalo sabafundi abathelelekile.

sourceString: Mandatory school closures and other social distancing measures were associated with a 29% to 37% reduction in influenza transmission rates.
targetString: Ukuvala izikole okuyimpoqo nezinye izinyathelo zokuhlukanisa ngokuhlala zahlobaniswa no-29% kuya ku-37% wokwehla kwezinga lokudluliselana nge-influenza.

sourceString: Early school closures in the United States delayed the peak of the 2009 H1N1 Flu pandemic.
targetString: Ukuvala izikole kusenesikhathi e-United States kwabangela ukuphuza kokuphakama kobhubhane lango-2009 lwe-H1N1 Flu.

sourceString: Despite the overall success of closing schools, a study of school closures in Michigan found that "district level reactive school closures were ineffective."During the swine flu outbreak in 2009 in the UK, in an article titled "Closure of schools during an influenza pandemic" published in the Lancet Infectious Diseases, a group of epidemiologists endorsed the closure of schools in order to interrupt the course of the infection, slow further spread and buy time to research and produce a vaccine.
targetString: Yize kunempumelelo ekuvaleni izikole, ucwaningo lokuvala izikole e-Michigan lwathola ukuthi "ukuvalwa kwezikole ezingeni lezifunda akunayo impumelelo. "Phakathi nokuqubuka kwe-swine flu ka-2009 e-UK, ephepheni elibhalwe ukuthi "Ukuvala izikole phakathi nobhubhane lwe-influenza" olwanyatheliswa i-Lancet Infectious Diseases, iqembu lama-epidemiologists lavumela ukuvalwa kwezikole ukuze kuphazamiswe inkambo yesifo, ukunensisa ukusabalala okuqhubekayo bese kuthenga isikhathi sokucwaninga futhi kwakhiwe ikhambi.

sourceString: Having studied previous influenza pandemics including the 1918 flu pandemic, the influenza pandemic of 1957 and the 1968 flu pandemic, they reported on the economic and workforce effect school closure would have, particularly with a large percentage of doctors and nurses being women, of whom half had children under the age of 16.
targetString: Bekwazile ukufunda ngaphambili kuma-influenza pandemics ahlanganisa i-1918 flu pandemic, i-influenza pandemic ka-1957 kanye ne-1968 flu pandemic, bafaka umbiko womthelela ukuvalwa kwezikole okuzoba nawo kwezomnotho nabasebenzi, ikakhulukazi njengoba iphesenti enkulu yodokotela nabahlengikazi kungabesimame, abanye babo abanabantwana abangaphansi kweminyaka engu-16.

sourceString: They also looked at the dynamics of the spread of influenza in France during French school holidays and noted that cases of flu dropped when schools closed and re-emerged when they re-opened.
targetString: Baphinde babuka amandla okusabalala kwe-influenza e-France phakathi namaholidi eskole e-France baqaphela ukuthi izibonelo zomkhuhlane zehla lapho izikole zivaliwe futhi zavuka kabusha lapho zivulwa.

sourceString: They noted that when teachers in Israel went on strike during the flu season of 1999–2000, visits to doctors and the number of respiratory infections dropped by more than a fifth and more than two fifths respectively.
targetString: Baqaphela ukuthi lapho othisha e-Israel benesiteleka phakathi nenkathi yonyaka yomkhuhlane ka-1999–2000, ukuvakashela kodokotela kanyenye nesibalo sezifo zokuphefumula sehla ngezingxenye eziyisihlanu nangaphezulu kwezingxenye ezimbili zesihlanu ngayinye.

sourceString: For schools and childcare facilities, the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention recommends short-term closure to clean or disinfect if an infected person has been in a school building regardless of community spread.
targetString: Mayelana nezikole nezindawo zokunakekela izingane, i-U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention ikhuthaza ukuvala isikhashana ukuze kuhlanzwe futhi kuqedwe amagciwane uma umuntu othelelekile ebe khona esakhiweni sesikole kungakhathaliseki ukuthi ukusabalala emphakathini kunjani.
