sourceString: When there is minimal to moderate community transmission, social distancing strategies can be implemented such as cancelling field trips, assemblies, and other large gatherings such as physical education or choir classes or meals in a cafeteria, increasing the space between desks, staggering arrival and dismissal times, limiting nonessential visitors, and using a separate health office location for children with flu-like symptoms.
targetString: Lapho kukhona ukudluliselana okuphansi kuye kusivivi emphakathini, amasu okuhlukana ngokuhlala angaqaliswa njengokukhanselwa ama-field trips, imihlangano, neminye imibuthwana emikhulu njengezemfundo zezemvelo noma amaklasi amakwaya noma ukudla ema-cafeteria, kwandiswa isikhala phakathi kwamadeski, ukufika ngezigamu nezikhathi zokugoduka, kube nomkhawulo kwabavakashai abangabalulekile, nokusebenzisa ihhovisi elihlukile ngendawo lokusebenziswa izingane ezinezimpawu ezifana nezomkhuhlane.

sourceString: When there is substantial transmission in the local community, in addition to social distancing strategies, extended school dismissals may be considered.
targetString: Uma kunokudluliselana okuqaphelekayo emphakathini wendawo, ngaphezulu kwamasu okuhlala ngokuhlukanisa, ukunweba inkathi yokuvalwa kwezikole kungacatshangelwa.

sourceString: On 26 January, China instituted measures to contain the COVID-19 outbreak which included extending the Spring Festival holiday to contain the outbreak.
targetString: Ngo-26 January, i-China yaqalisa izinyathelo zokuvalela ukuqubuka kwe-COVID-19 okwahlanganisa ukunweba iholidi le-Spring Festival ukuze kuvalelwe ukuqubuka.

sourceString: Universities and schools around the country closed.
targetString: Amanyuvesi nezikole ezweni lonke kwavalwa.

sourceString: On 23 February, Iran's Ministry of Health announced the closure of universities, higher educational institutions and schools in several cities and provinces.
targetString: Ngo-23 February, i-Iran's Ministry of Health yamemezela ukuvalwa kwamanyuvesi, izikhungo zemfundo ephakeme emadolobheni amaningi nezifundazwe.

sourceString: On 3 March, UNESCO released the first global numbers on school closures and affected students.
targetString: Ngo-3 March, i-UNESCO yakhipha izibalo zokuqala zomhlaba zezikole ezithintekile nabafundi.

sourceString: It reported that 13 countries had enacted preventive measures including the temporary closure of schools and universities, impacting 290.5 million students around the world.
targetString: Yabika ukuthi amazwe angu-13 ayemise izinyathelo zokuvikela okuhlanganisa ukuvala isikhashana kwezikole namanyuvesi, okwathinta izigidi zabafundi ezingu-290.5 emhlabeni wonke.

sourceString: In reaction, UNESCO called on countries to support affected students and families and facilitate large-scale inclusive distance learning programmes.
targetString: Isabela, i-UNESCO yabiza amazwe ukuthi asekele abafundi abathintekile nemikhaya futhi kuqaliswe kabanzi izinhlelo zokufunda ekhaya zabo bonke.

sourceString: On 4 March, the Italian government ordered the full closure of all schools and universities nationwide as Italy reached 100 deaths.
targetString: Ngo-4 March,uhulumeni wase-Italy wakhipha isiqondiso sokuvalwa kwazo zonke izikole namanyuvesi ezweni lonke lapho i-Italy ifinyelela isibalo sokufa kwabangu-100.

sourceString: In doing so, Italy became one of 22 countries on three continents which had announced or implemented school closures.
targetString: Ngokwenza njalo, i-Italy yaba elinye lamazwe angu-22 kumazwekazi amathathu ayememezele futhi aqalisa ukuvala izikole.

sourceString: On 5 March, the majority of learners affected by COVID-19 emergency measures were located in China, with 233 million learners affected, followed by Japan at 16.5 million and Iran at 14.5 million.
targetString: Ngo-5 March, iningi labafundi abathintwe izinyathelo zesimo esiphuthumayo se-COVID-19 babese-China, lapho izigidi zabafundi abangu-233 zathinteka, kulandele i-Japan nezigidi ezingu-16.5 ne-Iran ngezigidi ezingu-14.5.

sourceString: By 10 March, one in five students worldwide was "staying away from school due to the COVID-19 crisis" while another one in four was barred from higher education institutions.
targetString: Ngo-10 March, oyedwa kubafudi abayisihlanu emhlabeni wonke ube-"qhela kude nesikole ngexizathu senkinga ye-COVID-19" lapho oyedwa kwabane wayevimbelwe ezikhungweni zemfundweni ephakeme.

sourceString: On 13 March, governments in 49 countries announced or implemented school closures, including 39 countries which closed schools nationwide and 22 countries with localised school closures.
targetString: Ngo-13 March, ohulumeni bamazwe angu-49 bamemezela noma baqalisa ukuvalwa kwezikole, kuhlanganisa amazwe angu-39 avala izikole izwe lonke namazwe angu-22 anezikole zendawo ezivaliwe.

sourceString: By 16 March, this figure increased from 49 to 73 countries according to UNESCO.
targetString: Ngo-16 March, lesisibalo saphakama sisuka emazweni angu-49 kuye kwangu-73 ngokusho kuka-UNESCO.

sourceString: By 19 March, 50% of students worldwide were affected by school closures, corresponding to nationwide closures in 102 countries and local closures in 11 countries affecting 850 million children and youth.
targetString: Ngo-19 March, u-50% wabafundi emhlabeni wonke wathintwa ukuvalwa kwezikole, okuhambelana nokuvala ezweni lonke emazweni angu-102 nokuvala kwendawo emazweni angu-11 okuthinta izigidi ezingu-850 zabantwana nabasha.

sourceString: By 20 March, over 70% of the world's learners were impacted by closures, with 124 country-wide school closures.
targetString: Kusukela ngo-20 March, ngaphezu kuka-70% wabafundi emhlabeni bathinteka ukuvalwa, ngokuvalwa kwezikole izwelonke okungu-124.

sourceString: On 23 March, all Nigerian school were found to have been closed down by Nigerian government, markets as well as companies were closed down and children were forbidden by parents to step out of their homes.
targetString: Ngo-23 March, zonke izikole zase-Nigeria kwatholakala ukuthi zavalwa uhulumeni wase-Nigeria, izimakethe kanjalo nezinkampani zavalwa futhi izingane zanqatshelwa ngabazali ukuphumela ngaphandle kwamakhaya.

sourceString: On 26 March, all New Zealand schools and universities have been closed down across the country.
targetString: Ngo-26 March, zonke izikole namanyuvesi e-New Zealand kuvaliwe izwe lonke.

sourceString: The government has imposed a two-week holiday, allowing schools to transition to forms of distant teaching as soon as possible.
targetString: Uhulimeni waphoqa iholidi lamaviki amabili, evumela izikole ukuthi zishintshele kuhlobo lokufunda ekhaya ngokushesha ngangokunokwenzeka.

sourceString: Universities have closed for one week, but resumed with online teaching afterwards.
targetString: Amanyuvesi avalwe iviki elilodwa, kodwa aqhubeka ngokufundisa ngenqubo ya-online kamuva.

sourceString: Other school services remain open, but teaching is restricted to distant learning.
targetString: Eminye imisebenzi yesikole iqhubekile ivuluwe, kodwa ukufundisa kukhawulwe ekufundiseni ukude.

sourceString: By 27 March, nearly 90 percent of the world's student population was out of class.
targetString: Ngo-27 March, cishe amaphesenti angu-90 enani labafundi emhlabeni ubungekho eklasini.

sourceString: Regions with schools remaining open included Taiwan, Singapore, Australia, Sweden, and some U.S. states.
targetString: Izindawo eziqhubekile zinezikole ezivuliwe zihlanganisa i-Taiwan, i-Singapore, i-Australia, i-Sweden, nezinye izifundazwe zase-U.S.

sourceString: By 29 March, more than 1.5 billion children and other students were affected by nationwide school closures.
targetString: Ngo-29 March, izingane nabanye abafundi abangaphezulu kwezinkulungwane zezigidi ezingu-1.5 bathinteka lapho kuvalwa izikole izwe lonke.

sourceString: Others were disrupted by localized closures.
targetString: Ezinye zaphazamiswa ukuvalwa kwasendaweni.

sourceString: Until April 6, holidays were extended in all secondary schools of Turkmenistan.
targetString: Kuze kube ngu-April 6, amaholidi andiswa kuzo zonke izikole zamabanga aphakeme e-Turkmenistan.

sourceString: An order signed by the Ministry of Education as a preventative measure aims to prevent the spread of respiratory diseases in connection with the WHO coronavirus pandemic.
targetString: Uhlelo lwe-Ministry of Education oluyisinyathelo sokuvikela luhlele ukuvikela ukusabalala kwezifo zokuphefumula ngokuhambelana nobhubhane lwe-coronavirus ye-WHO.

sourceString: 10 countries have localised schools closures, UNESCO estimates  473,933,356  learners are potentially at risk (pre-primary to upper-secondary education) and 77,938,904 learners are potentially at risk in tertiary education.
targetString: Amazwe angu-10 anokuvalwa kwezikole kwendawo, i-UNESCO ilinganisela ukuthi abafundi abangu-473,933,356  bangaba sengozini (imfundo eyisisekelo-amabanga aphansi kuye kumabanga aphakeme) futhi abafundi abangu-77,938,904 basethubeni lengozi emfundweni yezinga eliphezulu.

sourceString: Note: Figures correspond to total number of learners enrolled at pre-primary, primary, lower-secondary, and upper-secondary levels of education [ISCED levels 0 to 3], as well as at tertiary education levels [ISCED levels 5 to 8] who could be affected should localised closures become countrywide.
targetString: Inothi: Izibalo zilingana nengqikithi yesibalo sabafundi ababhalisiwe, emabangeni emfundo eyisisekelo, amabanga aphansi, namabanga aphakeme [ISCED amabanga-0 kuya ku-3], kanjalo namabanga emfundo yezinga eliphezulu [ISCED amabanga-5 kuya ku-8] abangase bathinteke uma ukuvalwa ngezindawo kuba okwezwe lonke.

sourceString: Enrolment figures based on latest UNESCO Institute of Statistics data.
targetString: Izibalo zokubhalisa zisuselwe kudatha yakamuva ye-UNESCO Institute of Statistics.

sourceString: School closures in response to the COVID-19 pandemic have shed a light on numerous issues affecting access to education, as well as broader socio-economic issues.
targetString: Ukuvala izikole ngenxa yokusabela kubhubhane le-COVID-19 kukhanyise izinkinga ezimbalwa ezithinta ukufinyelela imfundo, kanjalo nezinkinga ezibanzi zenhlalo-mnotho.

sourceString: As of March 12, more than 370 million children and youth are not attending school because of temporary or indefinite country wide school closures mandated by governments in an attempt to slow the spread of COVID-19.
targetString: Kusukela ngo-March 12, izingane nabasha abangaphezulu kwezigidi ezingu-370 abayi esikoleni ngesizathu sesikhashana noma esingaziwa sokuvalwa kwezikole izwe lonke okuphoqwe ohulumeni bezama ukunensisa ukusabalala kwe-COVID-19.

sourceString: As of 29 March, nearly 90% of the world's learners were impacted by closures.Even when school closures are temporary, it carries high social and economic costs.
targetString: Kusekela ngo-29 March, cishe u-90% wabafundi emhlabeni bathintekile ukuvalwa kwezikole. Ngisho noma ukuvalwa kwezikole kuyisikhashana, kubizela izindleko eziphakeme kwezokuhlala nezomnotho.

sourceString: The disruptions they cause affect people across communities, but their impact is more severe for disadvantaged children and their families including interrupted learning, compromised nutrition, childcare problems and consequent economic cost to families who cannot work.
targetString: Ukuphazamisa ezikubangelayo kuthinta abantu kuyo yonke imiphakathi, kodwa ukuthinta kwakho kuba nzima nakakhulu kubantwana abaswele nemikhaya yabo kuhlanganise ukufunda okuphazamisiwe, ukondleka okululaziwe, izinkinga zokunakekela abantwana nemiphumela yezindleko zomnotho emikhayeni engakwazi ukusebenza.

sourceString: Working parents are more likely to miss work when schools close in order to take care of their children, incurring wage loss in many instances and negatively impacting productivity.
targetString: Abazali abasebenzayo kuyenzeka nakakhulu ukuthi bangayi emsebenzini uma izikole zivaliwe ukuze banakekele izingane zabo, kanjalo balahlekelwe umholo futhi izikhathi eziningi futhi kuthinte kabi ukukhiziqa.

sourceString: Localised school closures place burdens on schools as parents and officials redirect children to schools that are open.
targetString: Ukuvala izikole endaweni kuthwesa umthwalo ezikolweni njengoba abazali nezisebenzi ziqondisa izingane kulezo zikole ezivuliwe.

sourceString: Women often represent a large share of health-care workers and often cannot attend work because of childcare obligations that result from school closures.
targetString: Abesimame bavame ukwenza ingxenye enkulu yezisebenzi zezempilo futhi ngokuvamile abakwazi ukuya emsebenzini ngenxa yokubizela kokunakekela abantwana okuba umphumela wokuvalwa kwezikole.

sourceString: This means that many medical professionals are not at the facilities where they are most needed during a health crisis.
targetString: Lokhu kusho ukuthi izisebenzi eziningi zezokwelapha azikho ezindaweni zazo lapho zidingeka khona kakhulu phakathi nenkinga yezempilo.

sourceString: Lack of access to technology or fast, reliable internet access can prevent students in rural areas and from disadvantaged families.
targetString: Ukuntula amandla okufinyelela ezobuchwepheshe noma ukufinyelela ngokushesha, i-inthanethi ethembekile kungavimbela abafundi basemaphandleni nalawo avela emikhayeni entulayo.

sourceString: Lack of access to technology or good internet connectivity is an obstacle to continued learning, especially for students from disadvantaged families.
targetString: Ukuntula ukwazi ukufinyelela ezobuchwepheshe noma uxhumano okuhle lwe-inthanethi inkinga ekuqhubekeni kokwazi ukufunda, ikakhulukazi kubafundi abavela emikhayeni entulayo.

sourceString: In response to school closures caused by COVID-19, UNESCO recommends the use of distance learning programmes and open educational applications and platforms that schools and teachers can use to reach learners remotely and limit the disruption of education.To aid in slowing the transmission of COVID-19, hundreds of libraries have temporarily closed.
targetString: Isabela ekuvaleni izikole okubangelwe i-COVID-19, i-UNESCO ikhuthaza ukusebenziswa kwezinqubo zokufunda ekhaya nokuvulwa kwama-applications emfundo nama-platforms izikole nothisha abangakusebenzisa ukufinyelela abafundi bekude futhi kukhawulwe ukuphazamiseka kwezemfundo. Ukusekela ekunensiseni ukudluliselana nge-COVID-19, amakhulu emitapo yezincwadi avalile isikhashana..

sourceString: In the United States, numerous major cities announced public library closures, including Los Angeles, San Francisco, Seattle, and New York City, affecting 221 libraries.
targetString: E-United States, amadolobha amakhulu amaningi amemezela ukuvalwa kwemitapo yolwazi yomphakathi, kuhlanganise i-Los Angeles, i-San Francisco, i-Seattle, ne-New York City, okuthinta imitapo lowazi engu-221.

sourceString: For students without internet at home, this increases the difficulty of keeping up with distance learning.
targetString: Kubafundi abangenayo i-inthanethi emakhaya, lokhu kukhuphula ubunzima bokuhambisana nokufunda ekhaya.

sourceString: School closures puts a strain on parents and guardians to provide childcare and manage distance learning while children are out of school.
targetString: Ukuvalwa kwezikole kubeka umthwalo kubazali nabaqaphi wokuhlinzekela ukunakekela abantwana bese benakekela ufunda ekhaya ngesikhathi izingane zengekho esikoleni.

sourceString: In the absence of alternative options, working parents often leave children alone when schools close and this can lead to risky behaviours, including increased influence of peer pressure and substance abuse.
targetString: In the absence of alternative options, working parents often leave children alone when schools close and this can lead to risky behaviours, including increased influence of peer pressure and substance abuse.

sourceString: Many children worldwide rely on free or discounted meals at schools.
targetString: Izingane eziningi emhlabeni wonke zithembele ekudleni kwamahhala noma kwesaphulelo ezikoleni.

sourceString: When schools close, nutrition is compromised.Nutrition plays a critical role in cognitive development and academic performance for children.In Washington State, around 45% of the states 1.1 million students enrolled in traditional public and charter schools qualify for subsidised school meals.
targetString: Lapho izikole zivala, ukondleka kuyalulazeka. Ukondleka kudlala indima ebalulekile ekwakhekeni ukucabanga nokuphumelela ekufundeni kwezingane. E-Washington State, cishe u-45% wabafundi abayizigidi ezingu-1.1 ababhalise ezikoleni zomphakathi noma  izikole ze-charter bayakufanelekela ukuxhaswa ngokudla kwesikole.

sourceString: At least 520,000 students and their families may be affected by food insecurity as a result of school closures.School lunch programmes are the second-biggest anti-hunger initiative in the United States after food stamps.
targetString: Okungenani abadundi abangu-520,000 nemikhaya yabo bangase bathintwe ukungaqiniseki kokudla ngenxa yokuvalwa kwezikole. Izinhlelo zokudla kwesikole isinyathelo sesibili esikhulusokulwa nendlala e-United States ngemuba kwezitembu zokudla.

sourceString: Every year, nearly 30 million children rely on schools to provide free or low-cost meals including breakfast, lunch, snacks, and even dinner.In Alabama, where state-wide school closures as of 18 March have affected over 720,000 students, the state Superintendent announced that staff in schools disproportionately affected by poverty would create meal distribution networks to provide food for students who rely on school lunches.
targetString: Njalo ngonyaka, cishe izigidi ezingu-30 zabantwana zithembela ezikolweni ukuthi zihlinzekele ukudla kwamahhala noma kwenani eliphansi okuhlanganisa okwasekuseni, okwasemini, okokuhlafuna, ngisho nokwakusihlwa. E-Alabama, lapho ukuvalwa kezikole isifundazwe sonke kwaqala khona ngo-18 March kuthinte abafundi abangaphezulu kuka-720,000, Unsumpa wesifundazwe wamemezela ukuthi izisebenzi zesikole ezithintwe ngendlela engafani ubumpofu zizoqalisa amanethiwekhi okudlulisela ukudla ukuze kuhlinzekelwe abafundi abathembela ekudleni kwesikole.

sourceString: School closures negatively impact student learning outcomes.
targetString: Ukuvalwa kwezikole kuyithinta kabi imiphumela yomfundi.

sourceString: Schooling provides essential learning and when schools close, children and youth are deprived opportunities for growth and development.
targetString: Ukufunda kuhlinzekela ngemfundo ebalulekile futhi uma izikole zivala, abafundi nabasha baphucwa amathuba okukhula nokuthuthuka.

sourceString: The disadvantages are disproportionate for under-privileged learners who tend to have fewer educational opportunities beyond school.Student drop-out rates tend to increase as an effect of school closures due to the challenge of ensuring all students return to school once school closures ends.
targetString: Izikhinyabezi azilingani kubafundi abantulayo abavame ukuba namathuba ambalwa okufunda ngaphandle kwesikole. Izinga lokuyeka isikole livame ukuphakama njengomthelela wokuvalwa kwezikole ngenxa yezinselele zokuqinisekisa ukuthi bonke abafundi babuyela esikoleni lapho ukuvalwa kwezikole kuphela.

sourceString: This is especially true of protracted closures.Schools are hubs of social activity and human interaction.
targetString: Lokhu kuyiqiniso nakakhulu kulokho kuvalelwa okuvikelwe. Izikole ziyindawo yemisebenzi yenhlalo nokuhlangana nabanye abantu.

sourceString: When schools are closed, many children and youth miss out of on social contact that is essential to learning and development.When schools close parents are often asked to facilitate the learning of children at home and can struggle to perform this task.
targetString: Lapho izikole zivaliwe, abantwana abaningi nabasha bazophuthelwa ukuthintana kwenhlalo okuyinto ebalulekile ekufundeni nasekuthuthukeni. Lapho izikole zivala abazali bavamile ukucelwa balandelele ukufunda kwabantwana emakhaya futhi bangase bazabalaze ekwenzeni lomsebenzi.

sourceString: This is especially true for parents with limited education and resources.
targetString: Lokhu kuyiqiniso kakhulu kubazali abanemfundo elinganiselwe nezinsiza.

sourceString: Potential impacts of school closures and reliance on distance learning are not addressed in federal acts of legislation at this time.
targetString: Imiphumela yokuvalwa kwezikole nokuthembela ekufundeni ekhaya akukadingidwa kuma-federal acts of legislation okwamanje.

sourceString: Formal education — as opposed to informal education or non-formal education — tends to refer to schools, colleges, universities and training institutions.
targetString: Imfundo ehleliwe — ngokungafani nemfundo engahleliwe noma i-non-formal education — ngokuvamile ibhekisele ezikoleni, amakolishi, amanyuvesi nezikhungo zokuqeqesha.

sourceString: A 1974 report by the World Bank defined formal education as the following:Formal education: the hierarchically structured, chronologically graded ‘education system’, running from primary school through the university and including, in addition to general academic studies, a variety of specialised programmes and institutions for full-time technical and professional training.The majority of data collected on the number of students and learners impacted by COVID-19 has been calculated based on the closure of formal education systems.
targetString: Umbiko ka-1974 we-World Bank wachaza imfundo ehleliwe ngendlela elandelayo: Imfundo ehleliwe: ubumbano ngokwenziwe kahle, oluhlelwe ngamabanga okulandelana kwezikhathi ‘uhlelo lwemfundo’, esuka esikoleni samabanga aphansi kudlulele enyuvesi futhi kuhlanganise, ngaphezulu kwezifundo ezivamile zemfundo, izinhlelo ezihlukile zenqubo ekhethekile yezikhungo zesikhathi esigcwele eziqeqeshela ubuchwepheshe. Idatha eningi eqoqwa esibalweni sabafundi abathintwe i-COVID-19 ibalwe ngokusekelwe ekuvalweni kwezinhlelo zemfundo ehleliwe.

sourceString: The UNESCO Institute for Statistics provides figures on students impacted by COVID-19 corresponding to the number of learners enrolled at pre-primary, primary, lower-secondary, and upper-secondary levels of education [ISCED levels 0 to 3], as well as at tertiary education levels [ISCED levels 5 to 8].
targetString: I-UNESCO Institute for Statistics ihlinzekela ngezibalo zabafundi abathintwe i-COVID-19 ezihambelana nezibalo zabafundi ababhalisele imfundo emabangeni esisekelo, amabanga aphansi, amabanga aphakeme, [ISCED amabanga-0 kuya ku-3], kanjalo namabanga emfundo yezinga eliphezulu [ISCED amabanga-5 kuya ku-8].

sourceString: Early childhood educational programmes are usually designed for children below the age of 3 and may refer to preschools, nursery schools, kindergartens, and some day care programmes.
targetString: Izinhlelo zemfundo zeminyaka ephansi yobuntwana ngokuvamile aklanyelwe abantwana abaneminyaka engaphansi kwengu-3 futhi ingase ibhekisele ezikolweni zenkulisa, isikole sezingane, enkulisa, nezinye izinhlelo zokunakekela emini.

sourceString: While many primary and secondary schools have closed around the world due to COVID-19, measures impacting early childhood educational programmes have varied.
targetString: Yize izikole eziningi zamabanaga aphanzi namabanga aphakeme zivalile emhlabeni wonke ngenxa ye-COVID-19, izinyathelo ezithinta izinhlelo zemfundo ethinta ubuntwana obuphansi zihlukile.

sourceString: In some countries and territories, preschools and day cares are considered necessary services and have not closed in tandem with broader school closure measures.In the United States, the Washington State Department of Children, Youth, and Families encouraged child care and early learning centres to stay open.
targetString: Kumanye amazwe nezindawo, isikole sokuqala nezinkulisa zibhekwa njengemisebenzi ebalulekile futhi akuvalwanga njengoba kwenzekile ngezinyathelo ezibanzi zokuvala izikole. E-United States, i-Washington State Department of Children, Abasha, Nemikhaya bakhuthaze izinkulisa nezikhungo zokufunda kungakaphuzi ukuthi zahlale zivuliwe.

sourceString: Some school districts may offer alternative child care options, prioritising the children of first responders and healthcare workers.
targetString: Ezinye izifunda zezikole zingase ziphakamise izindlela ezihlukile zokunakekela abantwana, ukubeka kuqala izingane zabasabeli bokuqala nezisebenzi zokunakekela ezempilo.

sourceString: The governor of Maryland mandated that specific child care services remain open for the children of emergency personnel while Washington State and California have left it to the discretion of care providers.
targetString: UNdunankulu wase-Maryland waphoqa ukuthi imisebenzi ethile yezinkulisa iqhubeke itholakala kubantwana bezisebenzi zesimo esiphuthumayo laphi i-Washington State yona ne-California ikushiyele ekuzinqumeleni kwabahlinzekeli bokunakekela.

sourceString: California Governor Gavin Newsom explained his state's position, saying “We need our child care facilities, our daycare centers, to operate to absorb the impact of these school closures.”
targetString: Undunakulu wase-California u-Governor Gavin Newsom wachaza ukukhetha kwesifundazwe sakhe, wathi “Siyazidinga izindawo zethu zokunakekela abantwana, izinkulisa zethu, ukuthi zisebenze ukuze zimunce ukugadla kwalokhu kuvalwa kwezikole.”

sourceString: Colorado has encouraged the development of "tool kits" for parents to use at home to emulate the lessons children would have received in their early learning programmes.In Japan, Prime Minister Shinzo Abe closed all schools throughout the country until April 8, however, children's daycare facilities were excluded.
targetString: I-Colorado ikhuthaze ukwakhiwa kwama-"tool kits" abazali abangawasebenzisa ekhaya ukuze benzise izifundo abantwana okungabe bayazithola ezikhathini zokuqala zohlelo lokufunda. E-Japan, u-Prime Minister u-Shinzo Abe wavala zonke izikole kulo lonke izwe kwaze kaba ngu-April 8, kodwa, izindawo zenkulisa zazingafakiwe.

sourceString: In early March, five adults associated with a nursing facility for preschool children in Kobe tested positive for coronavirus.
targetString: Ekuqaleni kuka-March, abakhulile abayisihlanu abahlobene nendawo yabahlengikazi besikole sokuqala sabantwana e-Kobe bahlola baqinsekelwa i-coronavirus.

sourceString: After testing over one hundred children at the facility, a preschool student was found to be carrying the virus.
targetString: Ngemuva kokuhlola izingane eziphezulu kwekhulu kuleyondawo, umfundi wesikole sokuqala watholakala engumgcini wegciwane.

sourceString: Primary or elementary education typically consists of the first four to seven years of formal education.
targetString: Imfundo yamabanga aphansi noma ayisisekelo ngokuvamile enza iminyaka yokuqala emine kuye kweyisikhombisa yemfundo esemthethweni.

sourceString: The International Baccalaureate Organization (IBO) canceled the examinations for its Diploma Programme and Career-related Programme candidates scheduled between 30 April and 22 May 2020, reportedly affecting more than 200,000 students worldwide.
targetString: I-The International Baccalaureate Organization (IBO) yakhansela ukuvivinya kwayo kwe-Diploma Programme ne-Career-related Programme abafundi abahlelwe phakathi no-30 April no-22 May 2020, ngokombiko okuthinta abafundi abangaphezulu kuka-200,000 umhlaba wonke.

sourceString: The IBO stated that it would award candidates their diplomas or certificates based on "their coursework" and "the established assessment expertise, rigor, and quality control already built into the programme."
targetString: I-IBO yasho ukuthi izoklomelisa abakhethiwe amadiploma noma izitifiketi ngokusekelwe "emsebenzini wokufundisa wabo" kanye "nesivivinyo sokuhlola esimisiwe, ukucophelela, nesimo sokulawula esakhelwe kakade ohlelweni."

sourceString: Tertiary education, also known as higher education, refers to the non-compulsory educational levels that follow completion of secondary school or high school.
targetString: Imfundo yase-tertiary, ebuye yaziwe ngokuthi imfundo ephakeme, ibhekisele kumazinga okufunda angaphoqiwe alandela ukuphetha isikole samabanga aphakeme noma i-high school.

sourceString: Tertiary education is normally taken to include undergraduate and postgraduate education, as well as vocational education and training.
targetString: Imfundo yase-tertiary ngokuvamile ithathwa njengehlanganisa imfundo ye-undergraduate ne-postgraduate, kanjalo nemfundo nokuqeqeshwa kwe-vocational.

sourceString: Individuals who complete tertiary education generally receive certificates, diplomas, or academic degrees.
targetString: Labo abaphothula imfundo yase-tertiary ngokuvamile bathola izitifiketi, amadiploma, noma amadigri ezifundo.

sourceString: Undergraduate education is education conducted after secondary education and prior to post-graduate education, for which the learner is typically awarded a bachelor's degree.
targetString: Imfundo ye-undergraduate imfundo eqhutshwa ngemuva kwemfundo yebanga eliphakeme futhi ngaphambi kwemfundo ye-post-graduate, lapho umfundi ngokuvamile eklomeliswa i-bachelor's degree.

sourceString: Students enrolled in higher education programmes at colleges, universities, and community colleges are often refereed to in countries such as United States as "college students."The closure of colleges and universities has widespread implications for students, faculty, administrators, and the institutions themselves.
targetString: Abafundi ababhalisele izinhlelo zemfundo ephakeme kumakolishi, amanyuvesi, namakolishi omphakathi ngokuvamile abizwa ngokuthi "abafundi basekolishi" emazweni afana ne-United States. Ukuvalwa kwamakolishi namnyuvesi kunomthelela obanzi kubafundi, abaphathi bomkhakha, nezikhungo uqobo lwazo.

sourceString: Colleges and universities across the United States have been called upon to issue refunds to students for the cost of tuition and room and board.
targetString: Amakolishi namanyuvesi kulo lonke elase-United States aye acelwa ukuba abuyisele emuva izimali kubafundi zezindleko zokufunda nendlu, nokuhlala.

sourceString: In the United States of America, Colleges and universities operate as "mini-cities" which generate significant revenue for cities, states, and regions.
targetString: E-United States of America, amakolishi namanyuvesi asebenza njengama-"dolobha amancane" akhiqiza inkokhelo eqaphelekayo kumadolobha, izifunda, nezifundazwe.

sourceString: For example, Princeton University contributed $1.58 billion USD to the New Jersey economy and students spent about $60 million in off-campus spending.
targetString: Ngokwesibonelo, i-Princeton University yathelela ngo-$1.58 billion USD kumnotho we-New Jersey futhi abafundi bachitha cishe u-$60 million wokuthenga ngaphandle kwekhempasi.

sourceString: College and university closures have a domino effect on economies with far-reaching implications.According to Linda Bilmes of the Harvard Kennedy School, "local hotels, restaurants, cafes, shops, car rental agencies and other local businesses obtain a significant share of annual revenue from graduation week and college reunions...
targetString: Ukuvalwa kwamakolishi namanyuvesi kuba nomphumela wamadomino kwezomnotho nemthelela ehamba ibanga elide. Ngokusho kuka-Linda Bilmes we-Harvard Kennedy School, "amahhotela endawo, izindawo zokudlela, amakhafe, izitolo, abaqashisa ngezimoto namanye amabhizinisi endawo athola ingxenye ethile yomholo wonyaka ovela ngeviki le-graduation nokuhlangana futhi kwasekolishi...

sourceString: these communities will suffer a lot of economic damage if the colleges remain closed at that time."Small towns which rely on college students to support the local economy and provide labour to local businesses are especially impacted by school closures and the exodus of students from campus.
targetString: le miphakathi izohlushwa ukulimala okukhulu kwezomnotho uma lamakolishi eqhubeka evaliwe kulenkathi. "Amadolobha amancane athembela kubafundi basekoloshi ukuthi basekele umnotho wendawo futhi basebenzele amabhizinisi endawo athinteke ngokukhethekile ukuvalwa kwezikole nokuhamba kwabafundi ekhempasi.

sourceString: In Ithaca, New York, Cornell University students spent at least $4 million a week in Tompkins county.
targetString: E-Ithaca, e-New York, abafundi base-Cornell University students basebenzisa okungenani izigidi ezingu-$4 ngeviki e-Tompkins county.

sourceString: In the wake of Cornell's decision to keep students home following spring break and transition to virtual instruction, the Mayor of Ithaca called for "immediate and forceful federal action — we will see a horrific economic impact as a result of Cornell University closing."
targetString: Ekulandeleni kwesinqumo se-Cornell sokugcina abafundi emakhaya ngemuva kwekhefu lentwasahlobo bese bedlulela ekufundeni ngenqubo e-virtual, iMeya yase-Ithaca yabizeka "isinyathelo se-federal esisheshayo nesinamandla — sizobona imiphumela yomnotho emibi ngenxa yokuvala kwe-Cornell University."

sourceString: UNESCO is sharing 10 recommendations during this period:
targetString: I-UNESCO yabelana ngezikhuthazo ezingu-10 phakathi nalenkathi:

sourceString: Examine the readiness and choose the most relevant tools: Decide on the use high-technology and low-technology solutions based on the reliability of local power supplies, internet connectivity, and digital skills of teachers and students.
targetString: Hlola ukuzimisela bese ukhetha amathuluzi owadinga kakhulu: Yenza isinqumo ngokusebenzisa ezobuchwepheshe eziphakeme nezobuchwepheshe eziphansi kuye ngama-solutions ancike ekuthembekeni kukagesi wendawo, uxhumano lwe-inthanethi, namakhon oothisha nabafundi kweze-digital.

sourceString: This could range through integrated digital learning platforms, video lessons, MOOCs, to broadcasting through radios and TVs.
targetString: Lokhu kungahamba ibanga lama-digital learning platforms ahlanganisiwe, ukufundiswa ngamavidiyo, ama-MOOCs, kuye ekusakazeni ngomsakazo nama-TV.

sourceString: Ensure inclusion of the distance learning programmes: Implement measures to ensure that students including those with disabilities or from low-income backgrounds have access to distance learning programmes, if only a limited number of them have access to digital devices.
targetString: Qinisekisa ukuthi akekho obandlululwayo kuma-distance learning programmes: Qalisa izinyathelo eziqinisekisa ukuthi abafundi kuhlanganise labo abakhubazekile noma abavela emakhaya antulayo bayakwazi ukufinyelela ama-distance learning programmes, uma kuyisibalo esincane kuphela esingakwazi ukufinyelela anadivayisi edijithali.

sourceString: Consider temporarily decentralising such devices from computer labs to families and support them with internet connectivity.
targetString: Cabangela ukuhlukanisa isikhashana amadivayisi akumalebhu e-computer aye emakhaya bese niyisekela ngoxhumano lwe-inthanethi.

sourceString: Protect data privacy and data security: Assess data security when uploading data or educational resources to web spaces, as well as when sharing them with other organisations or individuals.
targetString: Vikela ubumfihlo bedatha nokuvikeleka kwedatha: Hlola ukuvikeleka kwedatha lapho ulayisha idatha noma izinsiza zezemfundo ezikhaleni zewebhu, nalapho futhi uma wabelana ngayo nezinye izinhlangano noma abantu.

sourceString: Ensure that the use of applications and platforms does not violate students’ data privacy.
targetString: Qiniseka ukuthi ukusebenza kwama-applications nama-platforms akulimazi ubumfihlo bedatha yomfundi.

sourceString: Prioritize solutions to address psychosocial challenges before teaching: Mobilize available tools to connect schools, parents, teachers, and students with each other.
targetString: Beka phambili izixazululo zokubhekana nezinselele ezi-psychosocial ngaphambi kokufundisa: Hlanganisa amathuluzi atholakayo ukuze uxhumane nezikole, nabazali, nabafundisi, futhi nabafundi omunye nomunye.

sourceString: Create communities to ensure regular human interactions, enable social caring measures, and address possible psychosocial challenges that students may face when they are isolated.
targetString: Yakha imiphakathi ukuze uqinisekise ukuxhumana kwabantu, vumela izinyathelo zokunakekela kwenhlalo, futhi ubhekane nezinselele ezi-psychosocial abafundi abangase babhekane bazo lapho behlukanisiwe.

sourceString: Plan the study schedule of the distance learning programmes: Organise discussions with stakeholders to examine the possible duration of school closures and decide whether the distance learning programme should focus on teaching new knowledge or enhance students’ knowledge of prior lessons.
targetString: Hlela ishejuli yokufundisa yama-distance learning programmes: Hlela izingxoxo nababambiqhaza ukuze kuhlolwe ubungako bobude bokuvalwa kwezikole bese unquma ukuthi i-distance learning programme kumele igxile ekufundiseni ulwazi olusha noma ekwenzeni ngcono okwaziwa umfundi ekufundiseni kwangaphambili.

sourceString: Plan the schedule depending on the situation of the affected zones, level of studies, needs of students needs, and availability of parents.
targetString: Hlela ishejuli ngokuncika esimweni sezindawo ezithintekile, izinga lokufunda, izidingo zabafundi, nokutholakala kwabazali.

sourceString: Choose the appropriate learning methodologies based on the status of school closures and home-based quarantines.
targetString: Khetha izinqubo zokufunda ezifanelekayo ezisekelwe esimweni sokuvalwa kwezikole nokuvalelwa emakhaya.

sourceString: Avoid learning methodologies that require face-to-face communication.
targetString: Gwema ukufunda izinqubo ezifuna uhlobo lokukhulumisana ubuso-ngobuso.

sourceString: Provide support to teachers and parents on the use of digital tools: Organise brief training or orientation sessions for teachers and parents as well, if monitoring and facilitation are needed.
targetString: Hlinzekela ngosizo kubafundisi nabazali ekusebenziseni amathuluzi edijithali: Hlela ukuqeqesha okufishane noma amaseshini olwazi othisha kanye nabazali, uma ukuqapha nokuqondisa kudingeka.

sourceString: Help teachers to prepare the basic settings such as solutions to the use of internet data if they are required to provide live streaming of lessons.
targetString: Siza othisha balungiselele amasethingi alula njengezixazululo ekusebenziseni idatha ye-inthanethi uma kufuneka benze i-live streaming yemfundiso.

sourceString: Blend appropriate approaches and limit the number of applications and platforms: Blend tools or media that are available for most students, both for synchronous communication and lessons, and for asynchronous learning.
targetString: Hlanganasi izindlela ezifanelekayo kodwa ubeke umkhawulo wesibalo sama-applications nama-platforms: Hlanganisa amathuluzi noma imidiya etholakalayo kubo bonke abafundi, kwakho kokubili ukuxhumana okuvumelanisiwe nokufunda kanye nokufunda okungavumelanisiwe.

sourceString: Avoid overloading students and parents by asking them to download and test too many applications or platforms.
targetString: Gwema ukulayisha abafundi nabazali ngokweqile ngokubacela ukudawuniloda futhi bahlole ama-applications nama-platforms amaningi.

sourceString: Develop distance learning rules and monitor students’ learning process: Define the rules with parents and students on distance learning.
targetString: Yakha imithetho yokufunda ekhaya futhi ulandelele inqubo yokufunda komfundi: Chaza imithetho kubazali nabafundi yokufunda ekhaya.

sourceString: Design formative questions, tests, or exercises to monitor closely students’ learning process.
targetString: Yenza imibuzo eyakhayo, ukuhlola, noma imisebenzi ukuze ulandelele eduze inqubo yokufunda komfundi.

sourceString: Try to use tools to support submission of students’ feedback and avoid overloading parents by requesting them to scan and send students’ feedback
targetString: Zama ukusebenzisa amathuluzi asekela ukulethwa kwezimpendulo zabafundi futhi ugweme ukulayisha abazali ngokweqilengokubacela ukuthi baskene futhi bathumele izimpendulo zabafundi

sourceString: Define the duration of distance learning units based on students’ self-regulation skills: Keep a coherent timing according to the level of the students’ self-regulation and metacognitive abilities especially for livestreaming classes.
targetString: Chaza ubude bamayunithi okufunda ekhaya ngokusekelwe kumakhono omfundi okuzilawula: Gcina isikhathi esihambelanayo nebanga lokuzilawula komfundi namakhono okucabanga ngokucabanga ikakhulukazi kumaklasi e-livestreaming.

sourceString: Preferably, the unit for primary school students should not be more than 20 minutes, and no longer than 40 minutes for secondary school students.
targetString: Okungono, iyunithi yabafundi besikole samabanga aphansi akufaele sibe ngaphe kwemizuzu engu-20, futhi singabi ngaphezu kwemizuzu engu-40 kubafundi besikole samabanga aphakeme.

sourceString: Create communities and enhance connection: Create communities of teachers, parents, and school managers to address sense of loneliness or helplessness, facilitate sharing of experience and discussion on coping strategies when facing learning difficulties.
targetString: Yakha imiphakathi futhi wenze ngcono ukuxhumana: Yakha umphakathi wothisha, abazali, nabaphathi besikole ukuze kuxoxwe umuzwa wesizungu noma wokungabi wusizo, qondisa ukwabelana ngokuhlangenwe nakho nengxoxo yamasu lapho ubhekana nezinkinga zokufunda.

sourceString: 290 million students out of school due to COVID-19: UNESCO releases first global numbers and mobilizes response,   UNESCO.
targetString: abfundi abayizigidi ezingu-290 abekho ezikoleni ngesizathu se-COVID-19: i-UNESCO ikhiphe isibalo sokuqala somhlaba futhi ihlanganisa impendulo,   UNESCO.

sourceString: Workplace hazard controls for COVID-19
targetString: Izilawuli zendowo yomsebenzi zengozi ye-COVID-19

sourceString: Workplace hazard controls for COVID-19 are the application of occupational safety and health methodologies for hazard controls to the prevention of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19).
targetString: Izilawuli zengozi endaweni yomsebenzi ze-COVID-19 ukusebenziswa kwezinqubo zokulawula izingozi ze-occupational safety and health ekuvikeleni isifoe se-coronavirus 2019 (COVID-19).

sourceString: The proper hazard controls in the workplace depend on the worksite and job task, based on a risk assessment of sources of exposure, disease severity in the community, and risk factors of individual workers who may be vulnerable to contracting COVID-19.
targetString: Izilawuli ezifanele zengozi endaweni yomsebenzi zincike endaweni yokusebenza nohlobo lomsebenzi, ngokusekela ekuhloleni ubungozi bemithombo yokuchayeka, ubunzima besifo emphakathini, nezinto eziyingozi kubasebenzi ngabanye okungenzeka babuthaka ekunqandeni i-COVID-19.

sourceString: According to the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), lower exposure risk jobs have minimal occupational contact with the public and other coworkers, for which basic infection prevention measures are recommended, including hand washing, encouraging workers to stay home if they are sick, respiratory etiquette, and maintaining routine cleaning and disinfecting of the work environment.
targetString: Ngokusho kwe-U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), imisebenzi enokuchayeka okuphansi kwengozi inezinga eliphansi lokuthintana nomphakathi nezinye izisebenzi, okuthi izinyathelo ezilula zokuvikela ziyakhuthazwa, kuhlanganisa ukuhlanza izandla, ukukhuthaza izisebenzi ukuthi zihlale emakhaya uma zigula, imikhuba emihle yokuphefumula, nokugcina inqubo yokuhlanza nokubulala amagciwane endaweni yokusebenza.

sourceString: Medium exposure risk jobs include those that require frequent or close contact with people who are not known or suspected with COVID-19, but may be infected due to ongoing community transmission or international travel.
targetString: Imisebenzi enokuchayeka engozini okuphakathi ihlanganisa leyo efuna ukuthinta njalo futhi okuseduze nabantu abangaziwa noma abasolwa ukuba ne-COVID-19, kodwa bangase babe negciwane ngenxa yokudluliselana okuqhubekayo emphakathini noma ukuvakashela emazweni angaphandle.

sourceString: This includes workers who have contact with the general public such as in schools, high-population-density work environments, and some high-volume retail settings.
targetString: Lokhu kuhlanganisa izisebenzi ezinokuthintana nomphakathi ovamile njengezikole, izindawe zokusebenza ezigcwala abantu abaminyene, kanye nezimo zokuthengisa ezinabaningi.

sourceString: Hazard controls for this group, in addition to basic infection prevention measures, include ventilation using high-efficiency air filters, sneeze guards, and having personal protective equipment available in case a person with COVID-19 is encountered.
targetString: Izilawuli zengozi kuleli qembu, ngaphezu kwezinyathelo zokuvikela igciwane ezilula, zihlanganisa i-ventilation esebenzisa i-high-efficiency air filters, ama-sneeze guards, kanye nokuba ne-personal protective equipment etholakalayo ezimweni lapho kutholakala umuntu one- COVID-19.

sourceString: OSHA considers healthcare and mortuary workers exposed to known or suspected person with COVID-19 to be at high exposure risk, which increases to very high exposure risk if workers perform aerosol-generating procedures on, or collect or handle specimens from, known or suspected person with COVID-19.
targetString: I-OSHA ibheka abasebenzi bezempilo nabasemakhazeni abachayeka kubantu abaziwayo noma abasolwa ngokuba ne-COVID-19 njengabasengozini ephakeme yokuchayeka, okuphakamela engozini ephakeme kakhulu yokuchayeka uma izisebenzi zenza ama-aerosol-generating procedures, noma zilanda noma ziphatha ama-specimens asuka kubantu abaziwayo noma abasolwa ngokuba ne-COVID-19.

sourceString: Hazard controls appropriate for these workers include engineering controls such as negative pressure ventilation rooms, and personal protective equipment appropriate to the job task.
targetString: Izilawuli zengozi ezifanelekayo kulezi sebenzi kuhlanganisa izilawuli zokwakha njengama-negative pressure ventilation rooms, ne- personal protective equipment efanele emsebenzini.

sourceString: COVID-19 outbreaks can have several effects within the workplace.
targetString: ukuqubuka kwe*COVID-19 kungaba nemiphumela enzima ngaphakathi endaweni yomsebenzi.

sourceString: Workers may be absent from work due to becoming sick, needing to care for others, or from fear of possible exposure.
targetString: Izisebenzi zingase zingabibikho emsebenzini ngenxa yokugula, isidingo sokunakekela abanye, noma ngenxa yokusaba ithuba lokuchayeka.

sourceString: Patterns of commerce may change, both in terms of what goods are demanded, and the means of acquiring these goods (such as shopping at off-peak hours or through delivery or drive-through services).
targetString: Imikhuba youthengisa ingase ishintshe, kukho kokubili uhlobo lwezimpahla ezifunekayo, anezindlela zokukuzithola lezi zimpahla (njengokuthenga ngezikhathi ezingekho matasa noma ngokulethelwa noma nemisebenzi yokudlula ngokushayela).

sourceString: Lastly, shipments of items from geographic areas severely affected by COVID-19 may be interrupted.An infectious disease preparedness and response plan can be used to guide protective actions.
targetString: Okokugcina, ukuthunyelwa kwezinto ezisuka ezindaweni ezithintwe kanzima i-COVID-19 kungase kuphazamiseke. Ukulungela isifo esithelelanayo nohlelo lokusabela kungasibenziswa ukuze kuqondise izenzo ezivikelayo.

sourceString: Plans address the levels of risk associated with various worksites and job tasks, including sources of exposure, risk factors arising from home and community settings, and risk factors of individual workers such as old age or chronic medical conditions.
targetString: Izinhlelo zibheka amazinga engozi ahilelekile ezindaweni ezingafani zokusebenza nohlobo lomsebenzi, zihlanganisa uhlobo lokuchayeka, izinto eziyingozi eziphakama ekhaya noma ezimweni zomphakathi, nezinto eziyingozi zabasebenzi ngabanye njengiminyaka ephakeme noma izimo zezifo ezingomahlalakhona.

sourceString: They also outline controls necessary to address those risks, and contingency plans for situations that may arise as a result of outbreaks.
targetString: Ziphinde zicacise ukulawula okufanele ukuze kuhlangabezwe lezo zingozi, futhi izinhlelo ezilandelayo zezimo ezingaphakama njengomphumela wokuqubuka.

sourceString: Infectious disease preparedness and response plans may be subject to national or subnational recommendations.
targetString: Ukulungela isifo esithelelanayo nezinhlelo zokusabela zingase zincike kokukhuthazwa umthetho wezwe noma wezifundazwe.

sourceString: Objectives for response to an outbreak include reducing transmission among staff, protecting people who are at higher risk for adverse health complications, maintaining business operations, and minimizing adverse effects on other entities in their supply chains.
targetString: Izinjongo zokusabela esimweni sokuqubuka zihlanganisa ukunciphisa ukudliliselana phakathi nabasebenzi, ukuvikela abantu abasengozini ephakeme yezinkinga ezinzima zempilo, ukugcina imisebenzi yebhizinisi, nokunciphisa imiphumela enzima kwamanye amabhizinisi nabaphakeli bokuthenga.

sourceString: The disease severity in the community where the business is located affects the responses taken.
targetString: Ubunzima besifo emphakathini ibhizinisi elikuwo kuthinta izinyathelo zokusabela ezithathwayo.

sourceString: The hierarchy of hazard controls is a framework widely used in occupational safety and health to group hazard controls by effectiveness.
targetString: Izitebhisi zokulawula izingozi ifremuwekhi esebenziswa kabanzi ku-occupational safety and health ekuhlanganiseni izilawuli zengozi ngemiphumela.

sourceString: Where COVID-19 hazards cannot be eliminated, the most effective controls are engineering controls, followed by administrative controls, and lastly personal protective equipment.
targetString: Lapho izingozi ze-COVID-19 zingasuseki, ukulawula okusebenza kangcono ukulawula kokwakha, kulandelwa ukulawu kokuphatha, futhi ekugcineni izinto zokuvikela umuntu siqu.

sourceString: Engineering controls involve isolating employees from work-related hazards without relying on worker behavior, and can be the most cost-effective solution to implement.
targetString: Izilawuli zokwakha zihilela ukuhlukanisa abasebenzi ezingozini ezihlobene nomsebenzi ngaphandle kokuthembela emkhubeni wesisebenzi, futhi zingaba isinyathelo esonga izindleko kakhulu lapho sifakwa.

sourceString: Administrative controls are changes in work policy or procedures that require action by the worker or employer.
targetString: Izilawuli zokuphatha izinguquko emthethweni womsebenzi noma izinqubo odinga isinyathelo sesisebenzi noma somqashi

sourceString: Personal protective equipment (PPE) is considered less effective than engineering and administrative controls, but can help prevent some exposures.
targetString: Personal protective equipment (PPE) icatshangela iphumelela ngezinga eliphansi kunokulawula kokwakha nokulawula kokuphatha, kodwa kungasiza ekugwemeni ukuchayeka okuthile.

sourceString: All types of PPE must be selected based upon the hazard to the worker, properly fitted as applicable (e.g., respirators), consistently and properly worn, regularly inspected, maintained, and replaced, as necessary, and properly removed, cleaned, and stored or disposed of to avoid contamination.
targetString: Zonke izinhlobo ze-PPE kumele zikhethwe ngokusekelwe engozini yesesebenzi, igqokwe ngendlela efanele njengokufanelekile (isib., amarespiretha), kugqokwe njalo futhi ngendlela, ihlolwe njalo, igcinwe, futhi ishintshwe, ngokwesidingo, futhi isuswe ngendlela efanele, ihlanzwe, futhi igcinwe noma or ilahlwe kugwenywe ukungcola.

sourceString: According to the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), lower exposure risk jobs have minimal occupational contact with the public and other coworkers.
targetString: Ngokusho kwe-U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), imisebenzi enokuchayeka okuphansi inokuthintana okuncane nomphakathi nezinye izisebenti ezingontanga.

sourceString: Basic infection prevention measures recommended for all workplaces include frequent and thorough hand washing, encouraging workers to stay home if they are sick, respiratory etiquette including covering coughs and sneezes, providing tissues and trash receptacles, preparing for telecommuting or staggered shifts if needed, discouraging workers from using others' tools and equipment, and maintaining routine cleaning and disinfecting of the work environment.
targetString: Izinyathelo ezilula zokuvikela igciwane ezikhuthaziwe kuzo zonke izindawo zokusebenza zihlanganisa ukuhlanza izandla kaningi futhi ngokwenzisisa, ukukhuthaza izisebenzi ukuthi zihlale ekhaya uma zigula, imikhuba yokuziphatha emihle yokuphefumula ehlanganisa ukumboza ukukhwehlela nokuthimula, ukuhlinzekela ngamathishu nezithako zomgqomo, ukulungiselela ukusebenzela ekhaya noma amashifu ashiyanayo kuye ngesidingo, khuthaza izisebenzi ukuthi zigweme ukusebenzisa amathuluzi abanye nezinto zokusebenza, futhi ziqhubeke zigcine inqubo yokuhlanza nokubulala amagciwane endaweni yomsebenzi.

sourceString: Prompt identification and isolation of potentially infectious individuals is a critical step in protecting workers, customers, visitors, and others at a worksite.
targetString: Ukutholakala okusheshayo nokuhlukaniswa kwabantu okungenzeka banegciwane isinyathelo esibalulekile ekuvikeleni izisebenzi, amakhasimende, izibakashi, nabanye endaweni yomsebenzi.

sourceString: The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) recommends that employees who have symptoms of acute respiratory illness are to stay home until they are free of fever, signs of a fever, and any other symptoms for at least 24 hours without the use of fever-reducing or other symptom-altering medicines, and that sick leave policies are flexible, permit employees to stay home to care for a sick family member, and that employees are aware of these policies.
targetString: I-U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) ikhuthaza ukuthi izisebenzi ezinezimpawu ze-acute respiratory illness kumele zihlale emakhaya kuze kube yilapho zingasenakho ukushisa, nezinye izimpawu okungenani amahora angu-24 ngaphandle kokusebenzisa imithi eyehlisa ukushisa noma eguqula izimpawu, nokuthi imithetho yezinsuku zokugula ibe egobekayo, vumela izisebenzi ukuthi zihlale ekhaya ukuze zinakekele ilungu lomndeni eligulayo, nokuthi abasebenzi bayazi lemithetho.

sourceString: According to OSHA, medium exposure risk jobs include those that require frequent or close contact within six feet (1.8 m) of people who are not known or suspected COVID-19 patients, but may be infected with SARS-CoV-2 due to ongoing community transmission around the business location, or because the individual has recent international travel to a location with widespread COVID-19 transmission.
targetString: Ngokusho kwe-OSHA, imisebenzi enokuchayeka okuphakathi ihlanganisa leyo misebenzi edinga ukuthintana njalo noma eduze ngamagxathi ayisithupha (1.8 m) nabantu abangaziwanoma abacatshangelwa ukuba iziguli ze-COVID-19, babe negciwane le-SARS-CoV-2 ngenxa yokudluluselana okuqhubekayo emphakathini oseduzane nendawo yokusebenza, noma ngesizathu sokuthi othile usanda kubuya ezweni langaphandle eliyindawo enokusabalala kokudluliselana nge-COVID-19.

sourceString: These include workers who have contact with the general public such as in schools, high-population-density work environments, and some high-volume retail settings.Engineering controls for this and higher risk groups include installing high-efficiency air filters, increasing ventilation rates, installing physical barriers such as clear plastic sneeze guards, and installing a drive-through window for customer service.Administrative controls for this and higher risk groups include encouraging sick workers to stay at home, replacing face-to-face meetings with virtual communications, establishing staggered shifts, discontinuing nonessential travel to locations with ongoing COVID-19 outbreaks, developing emergency communications plans including a forum for answering workers’ concerns, providing workers with up-to-date education and training on COVID-19 risk factors and protective behaviors, training workers who need to use protecting clothing and equipment how to use it, providing resources and a work environment that promotes personal hygiene, requiring regular hand washing, limiting customers' and the public's access to the worksite, and posting signage about hand washing and other COVID-19 protective measures.Depending on the work task, workers with at least medium exposure risk may need to wear personal protective equipment including some combination of gloves, a gown, a face shield or face mask, or goggles.
targetString: Laba bahlanganisa izisebenzi ezinokuthintana nomphakathi ovamile njengezikole, izindawo zokusebenza ezigcwala kakhulu abantu, nezimo zokudayisa zesimo esiphakeme. Ukwakha izilawuli zala maqembu engozi ephakeme kuhlanganisa ukufaka ama-air filters ezinga eliphakeme lokusebenza, ukuphakamisa izinga le-ventilation, ukufaka imingcele njengeziqaphi zokuthimula zepulastiki, nokufaka iwindi lokudlula ngokushayela lesevisi yamakhasimende. Ukulawula kokuphatha kuleli qembu lemisebenzi enokuchayeka okuphakeme kuhlanganisa ukukhuthaza izisebenzi ezigulayo ukuthi zihlale emakhaya, ukufaka indlela yokuxhumana ngenqubo ye-virtual ukuthi ithathe indawo yemihlangano yobuso-nobuso, ukuqalisa amashifu ashiyanayo, ukumisa uhambo olungabalulekile oluya ezindaweni ezinokuqubuka kwe-COVID-19, ukwakha izinhlelo zokuxhumana kwesimo esiphuthumay okuhlanganisa i-forum yokuphendula izinkathazo zabasebenzi, ukuhlinzekela abasebenzi ngemfundo nokuqeqeshwa kwakamuva mayelana nezinto eziyingozi nge-COVID-19 nemikhuba yokuzivikela, ukuqeqesha abasebenzi abadinga ukusebenzisa izingubo ezivikelayo nendlela yokuzisebenzisa, ukuhlinzekela ngezinsizi nendawo yokusebenza ekhuthaza inhlanzeko yomuntu siqu, efuna ukuhlanzwa kwezandla njalo, ukubeka umkhawulo wamakhasimende nomphakathi wokufinyelela indawo yomsebenzi, nokuposa izimpawu mayelana nokuhlanza izandla izinyathelo zokuvikela i-COVID-19. Kuye ngokuncika emsebenzini, abasebenzi abachayeka ngezinga eliphakathi bangase badinge ukugqoka izinto zokuzivikela ezihlanganisa inhlanganisela yamagilavu, ingubo, isembozo sobuso noma imaski yobuso, noma izibuko.

sourceString: Workers in this risk group rarely require use of respirators.
targetString: Izisebenzi ezikuleli qembu lokuchayeka azivamile ukudinga ukusebenzisa amarespiretha.

sourceString: If a person becomes sick on an airplane, proper controls to protect workers and other passengers include separating the sick person from others by a distance of 6 feet, designating one crew member to serve the sick person, and offering a face mask to the sick person or asking the sick person to cover their mouth and nose with tissues when coughing or sneezing.
targetString: Uma umuntu eqala ukugula ebhanoyini, izinhlelo ezifanele zokulawula zokuvukela abasebenzi nabanye abagibeli zihlanganisa ukuhlukanisa umuntu ogulayo nabanye ngebanga lamagxathi angu-6, ukubeka ilungu elilodwa le-crew ukuthi linakekele umuntu ogulayo, nokunikeza imaski yobuso kumuntu ogulayo noma ukubuza umuntu ogulayo ukuthi amboze umlomo wakhe nekhala ngamathishu lapho ekhwehlela noma ethimula.

sourceString: Cabin crew should wear disposable medical gloves when tending to a sick traveler or touching body fluids or potentially contaminated surfaces, and possibly additional personal protective equipment if the sick traveler has fever, persistent cough, or difficulty breathing.
targetString: Ikhru yekhebhini kumele igqoke amagilavu lapho inakekela umgibeli ogulayo noma ithinta ukutshezi lomzimba noma izindawo okungenzeka zingcolile, futhi kungenzeka ukuthi izinto ezengeziwe zokuzivikela uma ogulayo enokushisa, ukukhwehlela okungaphezi, nalapho kunzima ukuphefumula.

sourceString: Gloves and other disposable items should be disposed of in a biohazard bag, and contaminated surfaces should be cleaned and disinfected afterwards.For commercial shipping, including cruise ships and other passenger vessels, hazard controls include postponing travel when sick, and self-isolating and informing the onboard medical center immediately if one develops a fever or other symptoms while on board.
targetString: Amagilavu nezinye izinto ezilahlekayo kufanele zilahlwe ngesikhwama se-biohazard, futhi izindawo ezithole ukungcola kufanele zihlanzwe futhi zifakwe isibulala magciwane kamuva. Ngokuphathelene nemikhumbi yezimakethe, kuhlanganisa imikhumbi yokuvakasha neminye yokuthutha abagibeli, ukulawula ingoza kuhlanganisa ukuhlehlisa uhambo lapho ugula, nokuzihlukanisa futhi wazise isikhungo sokwelapha ngaphakathi ngokushesha uma othile eqala ukushisa noma ezinye izimpawu lapho esagibele.

sourceString: Ideally, medical follow-up should occur in the isolated person's cabin.For schools and childcare facilities, CDC recommends short-term closure to clean or disinfect if an infected person has been in a school building regardless of community spread.
targetString: Uma kungenzeka, ukulandelela kwezokulapha kumele kwenzakale kukhebhin yomuntu ozihlukanisile. Ezindaweni zezikole nenkulisa, i-CDC ikhuthaza ukuvala isikhashana ngenjongo yokuhlanza nokubulala amagciwane uma umuntu onegciwane eke waba ngaphakathi kwesakhiwo sesikole kungakhathaliseki ukusabalala.

sourceString: When there is minimal to moderate community transmission, social distancing strategies can be implemented such as canceling field trips, assemblies, and other large gatherings such as physical education or choir classes or meals in a cafeteria, increasing the space between desks, staggering arrival and dismissal times, limiting nonessential visitors, and using a separate health office location for children with flu-like symptoms.
targetString: Uma kunokutheleleka okuncane kuya kokuphakathi emphakathi, amasu okuhlukanisa ngokuhlala kungenzeka aqaliswe njengokukhansela ama-field trip, imihlangano, neminye imibuthano emikhulu njengemfundo yezemvelo, amaklasi ekwaya noma ukudla emakhafethira, ukwandisa isikhala phakathi kwamadeski, ukufika ngezigamu nezikhathi zokugoduka, ukukhawula izivakashi ezingabalulekile, nokusebenzisa indawo yehhovisi lempilo elihlukile lezingane ezinezimpawu ezifana nomkhuhlane.

sourceString: When there is substantial transmission in the local community, in addition to social distancing strategies, extended school dismissals may be considered.For law enforcement personnel performing daily routine activities, the immediate health risk is considered low by CDC.
targetString: Lapho igciwane lisakazeka ngendlela ephawulekayo emphakathini, naphezu kwemizamo yokuqhelelana kwabantu, kungase kucatshangelwe ukuvalwa kwezikole okweluliwe. Ezisebenzini zezomthetho ezenza imisebenzi yansuku zonke, ingozi yempilo ngaleso sikhathi ibhekwa njengephansi yi-CDC.

sourceString: Law enforcement officials who must make contact with individuals confirmed or suspected to have COVID-19 are recommended to follow the same guidelines as emergency medical technicians, including proper personal protective equipment.
targetString: Izisebenzi zezomthetho okumelwe zithintane nabantu abaqinisekisiwe noma okusolwa ukuthi bane-COVID-19 kukhuthazwa ukuba zilandele iziqondiso ezifanayo nezezisebenzi zezimo eziphuthumayo zezempilo, kuhlanganise nezinto ezifanele zomuntu zokuzivikela.

sourceString: If close contact occurs during apprehension, workers should clean and disinfect their duty belt and gear prior to reuse using a household cleaning spray or wipe, and follow standard operating procedures for the containment and disposal of used PPE and for containing and laundering clothes.
targetString: Uma kwenzeka kuba nokusondelana kakhulu lapho umuntu etholakala, izisebenzi kufanele zihlanze futhi zisuse amagciwane emabhandeni azo omsebenzi nezinto ezizigqokile ngaphambi kokuba ziphinde zizisebenzise ngesifutho noma indwangu yokuhlanza yasendlini, futhi balandele izinqubo ezivamile zokuvimbela ukusakazeka kwegciwane nokulahlwa kwe-PPE esetshenzisiwe nangokugcina nokuwasha izingubo.

sourceString: OSHA considers certain healthcare and mortuary workers to be at high or very high categories of exposure risk.
targetString: I-OSHA icabangela ukuthi izisebenzi ezithile zezokwelapha nezasemakhazeni zisengozini enkulu noma enkulu kakhulu yokuchayeka esifweni.

sourceString: High exposure risk jobs include healthcare delivery, support, laboratory, and medical transport workers who are exposed to known or suspected COVID-19 patients.
targetString: Imisebenzi yabachayeke engozini enkulu ihlanganisa abathumela izinto zokwelapha, izinto zokusiza, abasemalabhorethri, nezisebenzi ezithutha izinto zokwelapha ezichayeke ezigulini ezaziwayo noma okunezinsolo zokuthi zine-COVID-19.

sourceString: These become very high exposure risk if workers perform aerosol-generating procedures on, or collect or handle specimens from, known or suspected COVID-19 patients.
targetString: Lezi ziba izingozi ezinkulu kakhulu zokuchayeka esifweni uma izisebenzi zenza izinqubo ezisungula i-aerosol, noma eziqongelela noma zisingathe amasampula, avela ezigulini ezaziwayo noma okunezinsolo zokuthi zine-COVID-19.

sourceString: Aerosol-generating procedures include intubation, cough induction procedures, bronchoscopies, some dental procedures and exams, or invasive specimen collection.
targetString: Izinqubo ezisungula i-aerosol zihlanganisa ukufakwa kweshubhu emzimbeni, izinqubo ezibangela ukukhwehlela, i-bronchoscopies, izinqubo nokuhlola okuthile kwamazinyo, noma ukuqoqwa kwamasampula omzimba.

sourceString: High exposure risk mortuary jobs include workers involved in preparing the bodies of people who had known or suspected cases of COVID-19 at the time of their death; these become very high exposure risk if they perform an autopsy.Additional engineering controls for these risk groups include isolation rooms for patients with known or suspected COVID-19, including when aerosol-generating procedures are performed.
targetString: Imisebenzi yasemakhazeni yokuchayeka esifweni enobungozi kakhulu ihlanganisa izisebenzi ezihileleke ekulungiseleleni izidumbu zabantu abanezigameko ezaziwayo noma okunezinsolo zokuthi bane-COVID-19 lapho befa; lezi ziba ubungozi obukhulu kakhulu uma zihlola izidumbu. Izilawuli ezengeziwe zonjiniyela zala maqembu obungozi zihlanganisa amagumbi okuhlaliswa wedwa eziguli ezaziwayo noma okunezinsolo zokuthi zine-COVID-19, okuhlanganisa lapho kwenziwa izinqubo zokusungulwa kwe-aerosol.

sourceString: Specialized negative pressure ventilation may be appropriate in some healthcare and mortuary settings.
targetString: Ukungena komoya okukhethekile ngomfutho onegathivu kungafaneleka kwamanye amasethingi ezokwelashwa nawasemakhazeni.

sourceString: Specimens should be handled with Biosafety Level 3 precautions.
targetString: Amasampula kufanele asingathwe ngeziqondiso zokuphepha ze-Biosafety Level 3.

sourceString: The World Health Organization (WHO) recommends that incoming patients be separated into distinct waiting areas depending on whether they are a suspected COVID-19 case.In addition to other PPE, OSHA recommends respirators for those who work within 6 feet of patients known to be, or suspected of being, infected with SARS-CoV-2, and those performing aerosol-generating procedures.
targetString: I-World Health Organization (WHO) ikhuthaza ukuba iziguli ezifikayo zihlukaniswe zifakwe ezindaweni zokulinda ezihlukile kuye ngokuthi kunezinsolo yini zokuthi zine-COVID-19. Ngaphezu kwenye i-PPE, i-OSHA ikhuthaza ama-respirator kulabo abasebenza beqhelelene ngamafithi angu-6 neziguli ezaziwayo, noma okunezinsolo, zokuthi zinegciwane le-SARS-CoV-2, nalabo abenza izinqubo ezisungula i-aerosol.

sourceString: In the United States, NIOSH-approved N95 filtering facepiece respirators or better must be used in the context of a comprehensive, written respiratory protection program that includes fit-testing, training, and medical exams.
targetString: E-United States, ama-respirator ayisembozo sobuso esihlungayo e-N95 agunyazwe yi-NIOSH noma angcono kunawo kumelwe asetshenziswe njengendlela yohlelo lokuzivikela ngama-respirator olubhaliwe oluphelele, olubandakanya ukuhlolwa kokuba umqemane, ukuzivocavoca, nokuhlolwa kwezokwelashwa.

sourceString: Other types of respirators can provide greater protection and improve worker comfort.The WHO does not recommend coveralls, as COVID-19 is a respiratory disease rather than being transmitted through bodily fluids.
targetString: Ezinye izinhlobo zama-respirator zingavikela kakhudlwana futhi zithuthukise ukuphatheka kahle kwesisebenzi. I-WHO ayiwakhuthazi ama-coveralls, ngoba i-COVID-19 iyisifo esingena ngokuhogelwa hhayi ngokudluliselwa ngoketshezi olusemzimbeni.

sourceString: WHO recommends only a surgical mask for point-of-entry screening personnel.
targetString: I-WHO ikhuthaza kuphela imaski yokuhlinza ezisebenzini ezihlungayo ezindaweni okungenwa kuzo.

sourceString: For those who are collecting respiratory specimens from, caring for, or transporting COVID-19 patients without any aerosol-generating procedures, WHO recommends a surgical mask, goggles, or face shield, gown, and gloves.
targetString: Kulabo abaqongelela amasampula okuhogela, abanakekela, noma abahambisa iziguli ze-COVID-19 ngaphandle kwezinqubo zokusungula i-aerosol, i-WHO ikhuthaza imaski yokuhlinza, izibuko, noma i-face shield, igawuni, namagilavu.

sourceString: If an aerosol-generating procedure is performed, the surgical mask is replaced with an N95 or FFP2 respirator.
targetString: Uma kwenziwa inqubo yokusungula i-aerosol, kufakwa i-N95 noma i-respirator ye-FFP2 esikhundleni semaski yokuhlinza.

sourceString: Given that the global supply of PPE is insufficient, WHO recommends minimizing the need for PPE through telemedicine, physical barriers such as clear windows, allowing only those involved in direct care to enter a room with a COVID-19 patient, using only the PPE necessary for the specific task, continuing use of the same respirator without removing it while caring for multiple patients with the same diagnosis, monitoring and coordinating the PPE supply chain, and discouraging the use of masks for asymptomatic individuals.
targetString: Ngenxa yokuthi i-PPE ayitholakali ngokwanele emhlabeni, i-WHO ikhuthaza ukunciphisa isidingo se-PPE ngokuxhumana neziguli ngocingo, izivimbeli ezingokoqobo njengamafasitela abonisa ngale, okuvumela kuphela labo abahileleke ngokuqondile ekwelapheni ukuba bangene egunjini elinesiguli esine-COVID-19, basebenzise kuphela i-PPE edingekayo emsebenzini othile, baqhubeke besebenzisa i-respirator efanayo ngaphandle kokuyikhipha kuyilapho benakekela iziguli eziningi ezinesifo esifanayo, beqapha futhi belawula ukutholakala kwe-PPE, futhi benqabela ukusetshenziswa kwamamaski kubantu abangenazimpawu zesifo.

sourceString: WHEREAS on March 4, 2020, I proclaimed a State of Emergency to exist in California as a result of the threat of COVID-19;
targetString: NJENGOBA ngo-March 4, 2020, ngamemezela ukuba kube neSimo Esiphuthumayo e-California ngenxa yosongo lwe-COVID-19;

sourceString: and WHEREAS in a short period of time, COVID-19 has rapidly spread throughout California, necessitating updated and more stringent guidance from federal, state, and local public health officials;
targetString: futhi NJENGOBA ngesikhashana, i-COVID-19 iye yasakazeka ngokushesha kulo lonke elase-California, kwadingeka isiqondiso esibuyekeziwe nesiqine kakhudlwana esivela eziphathimandleni, ababusi, nezikhulu zezempilo zendawo;

sourceString: and WHEREAS for the preservation of public health and safety throughout the entire State of California, I find it necessary for all Californians to heed the State public health directives from the Department of Public Health.
targetString: futhi NJENGOBA ukuze kuvikelwe impilo nokuphepha komphakathi kuso sonke iSifundazwe sase-California, ngikuthola kudingeka ukuba bonke abantu base-California balalele iziqondiso zezempilo zomphakathi zaBabusi ezivela eMnyangweni Wezempilo Womphakathi.

sourceString: NOW, THEREFORE, I, GAVIN NEWSOM, Governor of the State of California, in accordance with the authority vested in me by the State Constitution and statutes of the State of California, and in particular, Government Code sections 8567, 8627, and 8665 do hereby issue the following Order to become effective immediately:
targetString: NGENXA YALOKHO, MANJE, MINA, GAVIN NEWSOM, Umbusi-sifundazwe Wase-California, ngokuvumelana negunya enginikezwe lona Umthethosisekelo Wezwe neziqondiso zeSifundazwe sase-California, futhi ngokukhethekile, izingxenye zeKhodi likaHulumeni ezingu-8567, 8627, no-8665 ngikhipha lo Mthetho olandelayo ukuba uqale ukusebenza kusukela manje:

sourceString: IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT:
targetString: KUDINGEKA UKUBA:

sourceString: 1) To preserve the public health and safety, and to ensure the healthcare delivery system is capable of serving all, and prioritizing those at the highest risk and vulnerability, all residents are directed to immediately heed the current State public health directives, which I ordered the Department of Public Health to develop for the current statewide status of COVID-19.
targetString: 1) Ukuze kulondolozwe impilo nokuvikeleka komphakathi, futhi kuqinisekiswe ukuthi isistimu yokwelashwa ngokwezempilo izokwazi ukusiza wonke umuntu, futhi kusizwe kuqala labo abasengozini nabachayeke kakhulu, zonke izakhamuzi ziyalwa ukuba kusukela manje zilalele iziqondiso zempilo zomphakathi zeZwe zamanje, engiyale uMnyango Wezempilo Womphakathi ukuba uzisungule ngenxa yesimo se-COVID-19 esikhona kuso sonke iSifundazwe.

sourceString: Those directives are consistent with the March 19, 2020, Memorandum on Identification of Essential Critical Infrastructure Workers During COVID-19 Response, found at: https://covid19.ca.gov/.
targetString: Lezo ziqondiso zihambisana neMemorandamu ye-Identification of Essential Critical Infrastructure Workers Yokusabela Phakathi Ne-COVID-19 yango-March 19, 2020, etholakala la: https://covid19.ca.gov/.

sourceString: ORDER OF THE STATE PUBLIC HEALTH OFFICER
targetString: UMTHETHO WESIKHULU SEZEMPILO SOMPHAKATHI WEZWE

sourceString: To protect public health, I as State Public Health Officer and Director of the California Department of Public Health order all individuals living in the State of California to stay home or at their place of residence except as needed to maintain continuity of operations of the federal critical infrastructure sectors, as outlined at https://www.cisa.gov/critical-infrastructure-sectors.
targetString: Ukuze kuvikelwe impilo yomphakathi, mina njengeSikhulu Sezempilo Somphakathi Wezwe noMqondisi woMnyango Wezempilo Womphakathi wase-California ngiyala bonke abantu abahlala eSifundazweni sase-California ukuba bahlale emakhaya noma ezindaweni zabo zokuhlala ngaphandle kwalapho kudingeka baqhubeke nemisebenzi yemikhakha ebucayi yombuso, njengoba kuboniswe la https://www.cisa.gov/critical-infrastructure-sectors.

sourceString: In addition, and in consultation with the Director of the Governor's Office of Emergency Services, I may designate additional sectors as critical in order to protect the health and well-being of all Californians.
targetString: Ngaphezu kwalokho, ngokuxhumana noMqondisi Wamasevisi Ezimo Eziphuthumayo weHhovisi Lomphathi-sifundazwe, ngingase ngiqoke imikhakha eyengeziwe ebucayi ukuze kuvikelwe impilo nenhlalakahle yabo bonke abantu base-California.

sourceString: Pursuant to the authority under the Health and Safety Code 120125, 120140, 131080, 120130(c), 120135, 120145, 120175 and 120150, this order is to go into effect immediately and shall stay in effect until further notice.
targetString: Ngokuvumelana negunya elingaphansi kweKhodi Yempilo Nokuvikeleka ethi 120125, 120140, 131080, 120130(c), 120135, 120145, 120175 nethi 120150, lo mthetho uzoqala ukusebenza njengamanje futhi uzohlala usebenza kuze kube yilapho sitshelwa ukuthi umisiwe.

sourceString: The federal government has identified 16 critical infrastructure sectors whose assets, systems, and networks, whether physical or virtual, are considered so vital to the United States that their incapacitation or destruction would have a debilitating effect on security, economic security, public health or safety, or any combination thereof.
targetString: Uhulumeni wombuso uthole imikhakha ebucayi engu-16 enamathuluzi, amasistimu, namanethiwekhi, kungaba aphathekayo noma awekhompyutha, okucatshangelwa ukuthi asemqoka e-United States kangangokuthi ukungasebenzi noma ukuqedwa kwawo kungaba nomphumela ongathandeki ekuphepheni, ekuvikelekeni komnotho, impilo noma ukuphepha komphakathi, nanoma yikuphi okuyinhlanganisela yalokhu.

sourceString: I order that Californians working in these 16 critical infrastructure sectors may continue their work because of the importance of these sectors to Californians' health and well-being.
targetString: Ngiyala ukuba abantu base-California abasebenza kule mikhakha ebucayi engu-16 baqhubeke benza umsebenzi wabo ngenxa yokubaluleka kwale mikhakha empilweni nasenhlalakahleni yabantu base-California.

sourceString: This Order is being issued to protect the public health of Californians.
targetString: Lo Mthetho ukhishelwa ukuvikela impilo yomphakathi wabantu base-California.

sourceString: The California Department of Public Health looks to establish consistency across the state in order to ensure that we mitigate the impact of COVID-19.
targetString: UMnyango Wezempilo Womphakathi wase-California ufisa ukusungula ukulingana kuso sonke isifundazwe ukuze kuqinisekiswe ukuthi siyawunciphisa umonakalo we-COVID-19.

sourceString: Our goal is simple, we want to bend the curve, and disrupt the spread of the virus.
targetString: Umgomo wethu ulula, sifuna ukunciphisa ukubhebhetheka kwegciwane, futhi siqede ukusakazeka kwalo.

sourceString: The supply chain must continue, and Californians must have access to such necessities as food, prescriptions, and health care.
targetString: Iketanga lemikhiqizo kumelwe liqhubeke, futhi abantu base-California kumelwe bakwazi ukuthola izidingo ezinjengokudla, imithi, nokwelashwa.

sourceString: When people need to leave their homes or places of residence, whether to obtain or perform the functions above, or to otherwise facilitate authorized necessary activities, they should at all times practice social distancing.
targetString: Uma abantu kudingeka baphume ezindlini zabo noma izindawo abahlala kuzo, kungakhathaliseki ukuthi bafuna ukuthola noma ukusiza ngalezi zindlela ezibaliwe, noma ukusiza ngemisebenzi edingekayo egunyaziwe, kufanele ngaso sonke isikhathi bahlale beqhelelene nabanye abantu.

sourceString: 2) The healthcare delivery system shall prioritize services to serving those who are the sickest and shall prioritize resources, including personal protective equipment, for the providers providing direct care to them.
targetString: 2) Isistimu yokunakekelwa kwempilo izobeka kuqala amasevisi okusiza labo abagula kakhulu futhi izogxila ekutholeni izinto zokusebenza, okubandakanya izinto zomuntu zokuzivikela, zalabo abasiza ngokuqondile.

sourceString: 3) The Office of Emergency Services is directed to take necessary steps to ensure compliance with this Order.
targetString: 3) IHhovisi Lamasevisi Ezimo Eziphuthumayo liyalwa ukuba lithathe izinyathelo ezidingekayo ukuze liqinisekise ukuthi liyahambisana nalo Mthetho.

sourceString: 4) This Order shall be enforceable pursuant to California law, including, but not limited to, Government Code section 8665.
targetString: 4) Lo Mthetho kufanele ugcinwe ngokuvumelana nomthetho wase-California, okubandakanya, kodwa okungagcini kuphela, kuKhodi kaHulumeni ingxenye 8665.
